title: GoMining taps industry veterans for new advisory board
body: Bitcoin ( BTC ) mining platform GoMining has formed a new advisory board to reinforce its strategic direction, enhance operational execution, and broaden its market presence, as revealed in an April 17 X post . The GoMining Advisory Board is here! We‚Äôve gathered industry veterans with deep know-how and the leadership to drive real change. @gleb_crypto ‚Äì CEO @blumcrypto , Ex- @binance exec who led Asia expansion. @ChartFuMonkey ‚Äì CEO at Magic Internet Moneyz, NFT and Web3 strategist.‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/APNfMmGa1Z ‚Äî GoMining (@GoMining_token) April 17, 2025 Two renowned industry veterans will be part of this new board. The first is Gleb Kostarev, the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) and co-founder of cryptocurrency trading app Blum.io. A former senior leader at Binance, Kostarev, oversaw the exchange‚Äôs expansion into Asia and the Commonwealth of Independent States . Coupled with a background in both centralized and decentralized spaces, the executive‚Äôs experience with large-scale growth initiatives is meant to bolster GoMining‚Äôs strategic posture as it endeavors to expand Bitcoin‚Äôs real-world applications. The second industry leader to join the board is Igor Milihram, known also pseudonymously as ‚ÄòChartFuMonkey‚Äô, the CEO of Magic Internet Moneyz. A Web3 veteran since the early days, Milihram was the first hire at Magic Eden ( ME ), where he helped launch hundreds of non-fungible token ( NFT ) projects on the marketplace and was a key player in shaping the platform‚Äôs growth strategy. ChartFuMonkey‚Äôs blend of practical expertise and deep market understanding could be a great boon for GoMining‚Äôs future endeavors. What are GoMining‚Äôs expansion plans? At present, GoMining‚Äôs BTC-centric ecosystem includes 3.5 million registered customers and has sold more than 7.5 Million THs globally. The platform offers access to digital mining and allows users to purchase Terahashes ( TH ) of mining capacity linked directly to its real-world data centers. By doing so, GoMining offers a convenient way for both newcomers and the DeFi -savvy to begin mining ‚Äî positioning it as a key driver of cryptocurrency adoption. Kostarev and Milihram, together with the rest of the GoMining advisory board, will support the expansion of the ecosystem ‚Äî and the long-term vision includes exciting new developments such as debit and virtual cards, a marketplace, as well as expanded functionalities made to expand the utility of every BTC reward gained through the platform. Moreover, there are plans for a BTC-FI-focused launchpad, with the goal of providing early access to a suite of Bitcoin-centric initiatives not just to users who stake on the GOMINING token, but those who own Terahashes as well. Featured image via Shutterstock The post GoMining taps industry veterans for new advisory board appeared first on Finbold .

title: Discover the Ultimate Real-World Asset with Bob Ejodame, VP Capital Markets at INX (Paris Blockchain Week Interview)
body: At this year‚Äôs Paris Blockchain Week, Bob Ejodame, VP of Capital Markets at INX, offered an insightful perspective on the evolving regulatory landscape in the United States, the emergence of real-world assets (RWA), and the broader implications for institutional and retail crypto adoption. A Shift in U.S. Regulation Ejodame began by addressing the notable shift in sentiment which was spurred from the election of President Donald Trump in November 2024. While concrete legislation is yet to be enacted and developed, the language from the White House signals a stance that‚Äôs pro-innovation, especially in comparison to past regulatory hurdles. ‚ÄúYears ago, being a U.S.-based company was a disadvantage in global conversations,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúNow, that stigma is fading fast.‚Äù Despite the early stage of proposed changes, Ejodame noted that optimism is already influencing international sentiment. The concept of a ‚Äúspecial purpose broker-dealer‚Äù and the expansion of custody rights for broker-dealers could unlock new opportunities, particularly for firms already operating under U.S. regulatory frameworks. To this point, CryptoPotato reported on April 11th that Donald Trump signed a bill that repeals the IRS DeFi broker rule, marking a major win for the cryptocurrency industry. RWA: From Hype to Infrastructure Real-world asset (RWA) crypto projects have been a major topic of discussion in recent years, but according to Ejodame, 2024 marked a turning point. Major asset managers like BlackRock and Franklin Templeton began to reveal the depth of their tokenization strategies, many of which had been years in the making. ‚ÄúThe winners last year were money market funds tokenizing treasury assets,‚Äù Ejodame observed. But looking forward, he believes stablecoins are poised to dominate the RWA conversation. While often overlooked in this context, he argues stablecoins are ‚Äúthe ultimate real-world asset‚Äù due to their utility in global financial rails. Another area he highlighted is the tokenization of private credit markets. A new product, a tokenized collateralized loan obligation with secondary trading capabilities, is expected to launch soon. This move could mark a new phase in blockchain adoption within institutional finance. On the retail front, Ejodame emphasized accessibility. Through tokenized equities, individuals in emerging markets can gain fractional exposure to publicly traded companies like Tesla or Google‚Äîan opportunity previously out of reach. The focus, he explained, is on enabling everyday investors in countries like Nigeria, Argentina, or the Philippines to invest in global markets for as little as $10. The Role of INX in a Broader Ecosystem Though the conversation was not promotional in nature, Ejodame briefly addressed INX‚Äôs recent acquisition by Republic. While the deal awaits regulatory approval, it represents a notable moment in the digital asset space. INX, previously a publicly listed company in Canada, had established itself as an end-to-end digital asset service provider‚Äîfrom token issuance to listing and dividend distribution. The acquisition by Republic, a firm known for its crowdfunding footprint in both the U.S. and Europe, opens up new possibilities for integrated, global capital markets infrastructure. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre combining capabilities,‚Äù Ejodame noted, ‚Äúand creating an ecosystem that supports the full lifecycle of a digital asset‚Äîfrom advisory and issuance to trading and distribution.‚Äù Conclusion From regulatory clarity in the U.S. to institutional breakthroughs in private credit, and increased access for retail investors globally, the RWA narrative is no longer theoretical. Bob Ejodame‚Äôs insights offer a confirmation of a rapidly maturing market where real-world assets are becoming central to the next wave of blockchain adoption. The post Discover the Ultimate Real-World Asset with Bob Ejodame, VP Capital Markets at INX (Paris Blockchain Week Interview) appeared first on CryptoPotato .

title: Exciting Times for Threshold Network: Strategic T Token Buyback Signals Bullish Reinvestment
body: Get ready for a jolt of energy in the crypto space! Threshold Network (T), a key player in decentralized privacy and bridging solutions, has just dropped some thrilling news. They‚Äôre not just sitting still; they‚Äôre actively reshaping their future with a strategic network restructuring and a significant T token buyback initiative. This isn‚Äôt just routine maintenance; it‚Äôs a bold move designed to supercharge the network‚Äôs efficiency and pave the way for exciting reinvestment opportunities. Let‚Äôs dive into what this all means for the Threshold Network and the wider crypto community. What‚Äôs the Buzz Around Threshold Network Restructuring? In a nutshell, Threshold Network is hitting the refresh button on its operational framework. Why? To become leaner, more agile, and ultimately, more effective. Think of it like decluttering your digital workspace ‚Äì getting rid of unnecessary expenses and focusing on what truly drives value. According to their official announcement via Chainwire, this network restructuring is primarily aimed at: Cutting Annual Operational Expenses: Streamlining operations to save costs. This is crucial for any project aiming for long-term sustainability in the volatile crypto landscape. Halting Treasury Sales of T Tokens: No more selling pressure from the treasury! This signals confidence in the T token‚Äôs future value and reduces potential market supply. Accumulating T Tokens via Buybacks: This is the exciting part. Threshold Network is actively buying back T tokens from the market. This can potentially increase demand and positively impact the token‚Äôs price. These changes aren‚Äôt just cosmetic; they represent a fundamental shift towards a more robust and economically sound Threshold Network. It‚Äôs a clear signal that the team is serious about long-term growth and value creation for its community. The Power of a Crypto Buyback: Why is Threshold Network Doing This? A crypto buyback , especially in the current market, is a powerful statement. It‚Äôs like a company buying back its own stock ‚Äì it often indicates undervaluation and a belief in future growth. For Threshold Network, the T token buyback serves multiple strategic purposes: Demonstrates Confidence: By investing in their own token, Threshold Network is showing strong faith in the project‚Äôs potential and future success. This can boost investor confidence and attract new participants. Reduces Token Supply: Buybacks reduce the circulating supply of T tokens. Basic economics tells us that with reduced supply and stable or increasing demand, the price can potentially rise. Strategic Reinvestment Tool: The acquired T tokens can be strategically reinvested back into the network‚Äôs ecosystem. This could involve incentivizing community participation, funding development initiatives, or supporting ecosystem growth. While the exact scale of the buyback remains undisclosed, the very act of initiating it speaks volumes about Threshold Network‚Äôs strategic direction. It‚Äôs a proactive move to strengthen the token‚Äôs value proposition and reward its holders. Strategic Reinvestment: Fueling Future Growth in the DeFi Space The restructuring and buyback are not isolated events; they are part of a larger strategy focused on DeFi reinvestment . Threshold Network is positioning itself to capitalize on the burgeoning Decentralized Finance (DeFi) landscape. How does this reinvestment manifest? Accruing tBTC: The Threshold DAO treasury will continue to accumulate tBTC (Threshold Bitcoin) through bridge fees. tBTC is a crucial component of their ecosystem, enabling Bitcoin to be used in the DeFi realm. Accumulating T Tokens: Through the buyback program, the treasury will also amass more T tokens. This dual accumulation strategy strengthens the DAO‚Äôs financial position and provides resources for future development. Focus on Core Technologies: With reduced operational expenses, Threshold Network can channel more resources into developing and enhancing its core technologies, such as tBTC and privacy-preserving solutions. This strategic reinvestment is about more than just financial maneuvering; it‚Äôs about building a stronger, more resilient, and more innovative Threshold Network within the DeFi ecosystem. They‚Äôre not just reacting to market conditions; they‚Äôre proactively shaping their future. What Does This Mean for T Token Holders? If you‚Äôre holding T tokens, this news is likely music to your ears. The restructuring and buyback initiative carries several potential benefits for T token holders: Potential Benefit Description Potential Price Appreciation Buybacks can reduce token supply, potentially leading to increased demand and price appreciation. Increased Confidence The buyback signals the team‚Äôs confidence in the project, which can boost investor sentiment and attract new buyers. Long-Term Value Growth Strategic reinvestment and cost efficiency measures contribute to the long-term health and growth of the Threshold Network, benefiting token holders over time. Stronger Ecosystem A more robust and efficient network with a healthy treasury benefits the entire ecosystem, including token holders who participate in governance or utilize network services. However, it‚Äôs crucial to remember that the crypto market is inherently volatile. While buybacks can be a positive catalyst, they are not a guaranteed path to price increases. Do your own research and consider your risk tolerance before making any investment decisions. Looking Ahead: Threshold Network‚Äôs Bold Future Threshold Network‚Äôs decision to restructure and implement a T token buyback is a significant step forward. It demonstrates a proactive approach to network management and a commitment to long-term sustainability and growth within the competitive DeFi landscape. By focusing on cost efficiency, strategic reinvestment, and strengthening the T token‚Äôs value proposition, Threshold Network is positioning itself for continued success and innovation. This move isn‚Äôt just about surviving market fluctuations; it‚Äôs about thriving and leading the charge in decentralized privacy and cross-chain solutions. Keep a close eye on Threshold Network ‚Äì their journey is just getting more exciting! To learn more about the latest explore our article on key developments shaping DeFi innovation and strategic crypto investments.

title: 3 Reasons a Shiba Inu (SHIB) Rally May Be Closer Than You Think
body: TL;DR Shiba Inu (SHIB) may be struggling now, but key indicators point to a potential comeback rally ahead. One of the factors is the burn rate explosion on a 24-hour scale. Ready for Liftoff? Despite its brief price increase towards the end of March, SHIB has been on an evident decline in the past 30 days. Currently, it trades at around $0.00001192 (per CoinGecko‚Äôs data), representing a 5% drop for the timeframe. SHIB Price, Source: CoinGecko However, some essential factors suggest a surge could be just around the corner. SHIB‚Äôs burn rate, for instance, has exploded by almost 2,000% in the last 24 hours, resulting in over 17.6 million tokens sent to a null address. Interestingly, a single transaction from a mysterious entity contributed to over 90% of the destroyed stash. The ultimate goal of the mechanism is to reduce the tremendous circulating supply of SHIB, thus potentially making it more valuable. Burning alone, though, doesn‚Äôt guarantee a stable price increase as it also requires a consistent or rising demand. Next on the list of possible price catalysts is the advancement of Shibarium. In the past weeks, daily transactions processed on the layer-2 blockchain solution have skyrocketed above three million, signaling strong user engagement and increased activity within the ecosystem. Shibarium supercharges the Shiba Inu ecosystem ‚Äì slashing fees, speeding up transactions, and burning SHIB along the way . As such, some believe its evolution could ignite fresh momentum for the price of the underlying token. Among the examples is the popular Bitcoin advocate Jeremie Davinci, who said : ‚ÄúI like Shiba Inu, as you know, and I think it will do relatively well in this cycle, but it may not go as high as you expect. I think Shiba Inu has a lot of utility now that they have Shibarium, and basically, it‚Äôs a chain that you can actually run all kinds of applications. However, nobody is using it, and there are no applications for using your tokens on Shibarium yet. If they get that solved , Shiba Inu will go to the moon.‚Äù Exchange Netflows SHIB‚Äôs exchange netflow is also worth observing. Outflows have been dominating inflows lately, suggesting holders are moving tokens off centralized platforms and into self-custody. This development could be considered bullish since it reduces the immediate selling pressure. Generally, when investors transfer their crypto holdings to exchanges, it is to dispose of them, and vice versa. SHIB Exchange Flows. Source: CryptoQuant The post 3 Reasons a Shiba Inu (SHIB) Rally May Be Closer Than You Think appeared first on CryptoPotato .

title: Altcoins may rally in Q2 2025 thanks to improved regulations: Sygnum
body: Altcoins may see a resurgence in the second quarter of 2025 as regulations for digital assets continue to improve, according to Swiss bank Sygnum. In its Q2 2025 investment outlook, Sygnum said the space has seen ‚Äúdrastically improved‚Äù regulations for crypto use cases, creating the foundations for a strong alt-sector rally for the second quarter. However, it added that ‚Äúnone of the positive developments have been priced in.‚Äù In April, Bitcoin dominance reached a four-year high, signaling that crypto investors are rotating their funds into an asset perceived to be relatively safer. Still, Sygnum said regulatory developments in the US, such as President Donald Trump‚Äôs establishment of a Digital Asset Stockpile and advancing stablecoin regulations, may propel broader crypto adoption. ‚ÄúWe expect protocols successful in gaining user traction to outperform and Bitcoin‚Äôs dominance to decline,‚Äù Sygnum wrote. Increased focus on economic value ignites competition Sygnum also said that competition would increase as the market focuses on economic value. Increased competition in a market often results in better products, ultimately benefiting consumers: ‚ÄúThe market‚Äôs increased focus on economic value compels greater competition for user growth and revenues, with rising protocols such as Toncoin, Sui, Aptos, Sonic, or Berachain taking different approaches.‚Äù Sygnum added that while high-performance blockchains address limitations of the Bitcoin, Ethereum and Solana blockchains, they find it challenging to achieve meaningful adoption and fee income. Sector breakdown by market capitalization. Source: Sygnum The report highlighted that some approaches have been more sustainable. These include Berachain‚Äôs approach of incentivizing validators to provide liquidity to decentralized finance (DeFi) applications, Sonic‚Äôs rewarding developers that attract and retain users, and Toncoin‚Äôs Telegram affiliation to access 1 billion users. Aside from layer-1 chains, Sygnum highlighted that layer-2 networks like Base also have potential. The report pointed out that while the memecoin frenzy on the blockchain pushed its users and revenue to new highs, it made an equally sharp decline after memecoins started losing steam. Despite this, Sygnum noted that Base remains the layer-2 leader in metrics like daily transactions, throughput and total value locked. Related: Italy finance minister warns US stablecoins pose bigger threat than tariffs Memecoins still a leading crypto narrative in Q1 Despite recent price declines, memecoins remained a dominant crypto narrative in Q1 2025. A CoinGecko report recently highlighted that memecoins remained dominant as a crypto narrative in the first quarter of 2025. The crypto data company said memecoins had 27.1% of global investor interest, second only to artificial intelligence tokens, which had 35.7%. While retail investors are still busy with memecoins, institutions have a different approach. Asset manager Bitwise reported on April 14 that publicly traded firms are stacking Bitcoin. At least 12 public companies purchased Bitcoin for the first time in Q1 2025, pushing public firm holdings to $57 billion. title: BlackRock Effect on US Spot Bitcoin ETFs! Negative Series Turns into Positive Momentum! Here Are the Details
body: US spot Bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs) recorded collective net inflows of $108 million on April 17, signaling a return to positive momentum in the crypto investment space. US Spot Bitcoin ETFs See $108 Million Net Inflow Led by BlackRock's IBIT Leading the charge was BlackRock‚Äôs iShares Bitcoin Trust (IBIT), which accounted for most of the day‚Äôs gains with $108 million in inflows. IBIT's strong performance underscores BlackRock's continued dominance of the U.S. spot Bitcoin ETF market as institutional and retail investors seek regulated exposure to Bitcoin. title: On-Chain Experiment Or Rug Pull? Base Faces Backlash After Unofficial Memecoin Crashes 90%
body: Coinbase‚Äôs Layer-2 (L2) Network, Base, has faced intense backlash over rug-pull allegations after it promoted an unofficial memecoin that crashed by over 90%, sparking a debate about the future of memecoins and on-chain content. Related Reading: Aptos (APT) To Continue Moving In ‚ÄòNo Man‚Äôs Land‚Äô ‚Äì Can It Reclaim $5? The Rise And Fall Of Base‚Äôs Unofficial Memecoin On Wednesday, Base‚Äôs official X account posted an image with the text ‚ÄúBase is for everyone.‚Äù Moments later, they shared a link to the on-chain social protocol Zora and the caption ‚ÄúCoined it,‚Äù sparking a speculative frenzy among investors. The protocol allows users to make social media posts into tradable tokens, automatically minting them. After Base‚Äôs post was turned into a token, the crypto community quickly skyrocketed its market capitalization to $17 million. However, online reports showed that the memecoin collapsed by around 92% after the top holders, who owned 47% of the supply, sold the memecoin just over an hour after launching. Some community members noted that the token was ‚ÄúHORRIFICALLY sniped,‚Äù while on-chain data analytics platform Lookonchain highlighted that ‚Äú3 wallets bought a large amount of ‚ÄòBase is for everyone‚Äô before Base posted and sold them, making a profit of ~$666K.‚Äù As a result, the community criticized the network‚Äôs team for the memecoin, calling the incident a rug pull and asking them to ‚Äústop launching worthless tokens that will all inevitably go to 0. You are diluting your brand and the value of real base assets.‚Äù Zora data shows Base has earned around $81,000 from the memecoin, which has recovered from the initial sell-off with a peak market capitalization of $26 million before retracing to the $9 million-$10 million range. Base‚Äôs Public Experiment Base responded to the backlash, clarifying they will never sell their holdings, but they weren‚Äôt an official network token either. The team explained that they posted on Zora because they believe everyone should bring content on-chain and use the tools that make it possible. Memes. Moments. Culture. If we want the future to be onchain, we have to be willing to experiment in public. That‚Äôs what we‚Äôre doing. To be clear, Base will never sell these tokens, and ‚Äã‚Äãthese are not official network tokens for Base, Coinbase, or any other related product. The content we share is creative, and we‚Äôre going to keep bringing culture onchain. The public on-chain experimentation opened a debate about memecoin culture and on-chain content, with Base‚Äôs creator, Jesse Pollak, weighing in. In a series of X posts, Pollak explained that ‚Äúnot all coins are the same,‚Äù outlining the differences between these two types of tokens. Is On-Chain Content The Future For Creators? According to his posts, a contentcoin is one piece of content with singular value and no expectations. Additionally, multiple of them can be created by the same person, with ‚Äúbig ones‚Äù potentially turning into memes. On the contrary, a memecoin is an ‚Äúaggregation of content,‚Äù with aggregated value and high expectations, where the creator ‚Äúshould‚Äù only create one. He also noted that big ones turn into projects. Related Reading: Is The Storm Over For Ethereum? Analyst Says ‚ÄòFace-Melting‚Äô Rally Comes Next Pollack considers that ‚Äúsomeone has to normalize putting all of our content onchain. and i‚Äôm not afraid for it to be us. why? because in the wake of the chaos, we‚Äôll normalize the behavior and create a better future for creators.‚Äù Nonetheless, many users remain skeptical, with community members also criticizing Base‚Äôs post announcing investors can mint a deleted scene of the ‚ÄúVitalik: An Ethereum Story‚Äù documentary, where the project‚Äôs founder, Vitalik Buterin, shows what‚Äôs in his backpack. ‚ÄúThrough ‚Äòthe financialization of everything‚Äô we come to learn that most things are worthless,‚Äù the user stated. Featured Image from Unsplash.com, Chart from TradingView.com

title: Decoding the sUSD Depeg Crisis: Synthetix Founder‚Äôs Alarming ‚Äòkain.depeg‚Äô X Rebrand Signals Uncertainty
body: Hold onto your hats, crypto enthusiasts! The world of decentralized finance (DeFi) is once again buzzing with activity, but this time, it‚Äôs tinged with a hint of uncertainty . All eyes are on Synthetix, a prominent synthetic asset issuance platform built on the Ethereum network, and its founder, Kain Warwick. Why? Because Warwick has made a rather eyebrow-raising move ‚Äì he‚Äôs changed his X (formerly Twitter) handle to ‚Äòkain.depeg‚Äô. Yes, you read that right: ‚Äòkain.depeg‚Äô. What‚Äôs the Buzz About ‚Äòkain.depeg‚Äô and the sUSD Depeg? This name change isn‚Äôt just a quirky social media update; it‚Äôs a direct signal, a digital flare in the night, pointing towards a significant issue: the sUSD depeg . For those unfamiliar, sUSD is Synthetix‚Äôs stablecoin, designed to maintain a 1:1 peg with the US dollar. However, since late March, sUSD has been struggling to hold that peg, and the situation seems to be escalating. As of the latest data, sUSD is trading at approximately $0.6895 . That‚Äôs not just a minor wobble; it‚Äôs a substantial deviation from its intended $1 value. To put it in perspective, that‚Äôs a downward spiral of 12.25% in just the past day , according to CoinMarketCap. For a stablecoin, such volatility is anything but stable and raises serious questions about its underlying mechanisms and future. Why is the sUSD Depeg a Big Deal? The concept of a stablecoin is pretty straightforward: it‚Äôs a cryptocurrency designed to have a stable value, typically pegged to a fiat currency like the US dollar. They are crucial for the DeFi ecosystem because they provide: Stability in Volatile Markets: Stablecoins act as a safe haven amidst the wild price swings often seen in the crypto market. They allow traders and investors to park their funds without exiting the crypto ecosystem entirely. Facilitation of Trading and Lending: Stablecoins are used extensively in trading pairs on decentralized exchanges (DEXs) and as collateral in lending protocols. A depeg can disrupt these crucial functions. On-ramps and Off-ramps to Crypto: Stablecoins bridge the gap between traditional finance and the crypto world, serving as easier entry and exit points. When a stablecoin like sUSD experiences a depeg , it undermines the trust in the entire system. Traders become wary, liquidity can dry up, and cascading effects can ripple through the DeFi space, potentially impacting other protocols and assets. Synthetix Founder‚Äôs ‚Äòkain.depeg‚Äô: A Cry for Help or a Bold Statement? Kain Warwick‚Äôs decision to change his X handle to ‚Äòkain.depeg‚Äô is undoubtedly a deliberate act. It‚Äôs a highly public way to acknowledge the elephant in the room ‚Äì the sUSD depeg . But what exactly is he trying to communicate? Transparency and Accountability: Changing his name to reflect the crisis could be seen as a move towards transparency. It‚Äôs a public declaration that he, as the founder, is aware of and taking responsibility for the situation. Urgency and Focus: The name change might signal a heightened focus on resolving the sUSD depeg . It‚Äôs a way to grab attention and rally the community and development team around the issue. A Call to Action: ‚Äòkain.depeg‚Äô could be interpreted as a call to action for the Synthetix community to come together and find solutions to restore sUSD‚Äôs peg. Potential Frustration or Despair: While less optimistic, it‚Äôs also possible that the name change reflects frustration or even despair at the severity of the situation. It could be an expression of the immense pressure he‚Äôs under. Regardless of the exact motivation, ‚Äòkain.depeg‚Äô has undeniably amplified the conversation around the sUSD depeg and put the spotlight squarely on Synthetix and its founder. Decoding the Reasons Behind the sUSD Stablecoin Crisis Understanding why sUSD is losing its peg is crucial. Stablecoin depegs can stem from various factors, often a combination of these: Liquidity Issues: Insufficient liquidity in the trading pools where sUSD is exchanged can lead to price slippage and difficulty in maintaining the peg. Smart Contract Vulnerabilities: While less common, vulnerabilities in the smart contracts governing sUSD could be exploited, leading to instability. Market Sentiment and Panic Selling: Negative market sentiment or fear surrounding sUSD can trigger panic selling, further driving down its price. Algorithmic Instability: If sUSD relies on algorithmic mechanisms to maintain its peg (though Synthetix primarily uses over-collateralization), flaws in these algorithms can lead to depegging. Collateral Concerns: If there are doubts about the collateral backing sUSD or its accessibility, it can erode confidence and trigger a depeg. It‚Äôs essential to investigate the specific mechanisms behind sUSD and Synthetix to pinpoint the root cause of this stablecoin crisis . Is it a technical glitch, a market-driven panic, or a more fundamental flaw in the design? Navigating the Uncertainty: What‚Äôs Next for sUSD and Synthetix? The sUSD depeg presents significant challenges for Synthetix and its community. However, crises can also be catalysts for innovation and resilience. Here‚Äôs what to watch out for and consider: Synthetix Team‚Äôs Response: Keep a close eye on official announcements and actions from the Synthetix team. How are they addressing the depeg? What measures are they taking to restore the peg and confidence in sUSD? Community Proposals and Governance: Decentralized communities often play a vital role in resolving crises. Look for community proposals and governance votes aimed at stabilizing sUSD. Market Monitoring: Track the price of sUSD closely. Are there any signs of recovery? Monitor trading volumes and liquidity across different exchanges. Risk Management: If you are holding sUSD or using it in DeFi protocols, assess your risk exposure. Consider strategies to mitigate potential losses if the depeg persists or worsens. Learning from the Crisis: The sUSD depeg provides valuable lessons for the broader stablecoin ecosystem. It highlights the importance of robust mechanisms, transparency, and community resilience in maintaining stablecoin pegs. Conclusion: A Crypto Wake-Up Call? Kain Warwick‚Äôs ‚Äòkain.depeg‚Äô X handle is more than just a name change; it‚Äôs a symbol of the uncertainty currently gripping the sUSD stablecoin and the Synthetix ecosystem. The sUSD depeg serves as a stark reminder of the inherent risks in the crypto world, even within seemingly ‚Äòstable‚Äô assets. It underscores the critical need for continuous vigilance, robust risk management, and proactive community engagement in navigating the ever-evolving landscape of DeFi. Whether this is a temporary setback or a deeper structural issue for sUSD remains to be seen, but one thing is clear: the crypto community is watching closely, and the response from Synthetix will be crucial in shaping the future of sUSD and potentially influencing the broader perception of stablecoin stability. title: Wild SEC Lawsuit Theory: What If XRP Case Is about Protecting Banks from Losing Billions in Fees
body: A recent tweet from prominent crypto commentator ‚ÄúAll Things XRP‚Äù has shed light on a contentious theory regarding the United States Securities and Exchange Commission‚Äôs (SEC) high-profile lawsuit against Ripple Labs. The post challenges the prevailing narrative that the lawsuit, filed in December 2020, was purely a matter of regulatory enforcement aimed at investor protection. Instead, it proposes that the lawsuit may have been strategically timed and executed to delay XRP‚Äôs rise as a low-cost, high-efficiency financial infrastructure that posed a direct threat to traditional banking institutions and SWIFT‚Äôs global payments network . WILD SEC LAWSUIT THEORY. What if the SEC‚Äôs case against Ripple wasn‚Äôt about investor protection‚Ä¶ but about protecting banks from losing billions in fees? Let‚Äôs follow the money, the timing, and the silence. You decide. pic.twitter.com/l1z25fjLsu ‚Äî All Things XRP (@XRP_investing) April 15, 2025 XRP‚Äôs Disruption and the Financial Threat to SWIFT The theory centers on several points, beginning with the SEC‚Äôs decision to sue Ripple and label XRP as an unregistered security. Following the announcement, XRP‚Äôs value plummeted by 66% in a single day, and Ripple lost significant business partnerships while exchanges began delisting the asset. At the time, XRP was facilitating approximately $70 billion in cross-border transactions every quarter, with each transaction costing just a few cents. This cost-efficiency sharply contrasted with traditional SWIFT wire transfers, which reportedly incurred fees between $20 and $50 per transaction, often accompanied by settlement delays stretching over several days. The Timing of the Lawsuit and the Role of Key Officials The tweet draws attention to the lawsuit timing, which was filed only days before then-SEC Chairman Jay Clayton resigned. It also highlights Clayton‚Äôs previous professional ties to major financial institutions, including Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan, and Barclays, through his former law firm. The commentator notes that Clayton‚Äôs wife was employed by Goldman Sachs and claims that various sources detailing these connections have been removed from the internet. According to ‚ÄúAll Things XRP,‚Äù the SEC‚Äôs enforcement action halted Ripple‚Äôs progress just as it was gaining significant traction. MoneyGram, which had partnered with Ripple for cross-border payments, suspended its use of XRP shortly after the lawsuit. Meanwhile, SWIFT began exploring blockchain-based settlement technology, with pilots reportedly starting in 2022. The implication is that the lawsuit created a window for traditional institutions to develop their blockchain initiatives without being disrupted by XRP‚Äôs rapid scaling. We are on twitter, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 ‚Äî TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) July 15, 2023 Comparisons to Ethereum and the Issue of Regulatory Consistency The post also questions why XRP faced intense regulatory scrutiny while Ethereum‚Äôs 2014 ICO, which bore structural similarities, was effectively cleared by the SEC. Former SEC official William Hinman publicly stated that Ethereum was not a security, despite allegedly receiving financial compensation from a law firm connected to Ethereum-related enterprises during his time at the SEC. Ripple, for its part, continued to fight the lawsuit, ultimately spending over $200 million in legal expenses. In July 2023, a judge ruled that XRP‚Äôs sales on secondary exchanges did not constitute securities transactions. The news sent XRP‚Äôs price up 73% in one day. However, ‚ÄúAll Things XRP‚Äù said by that time, the damage had already been done. Between 2020 and 2023, XRP was largely absent from U.S. trading platforms, and many institutions opted not to engage with it, effectively delaying its adoption during a critical window for financial innovation. A Shift in Political Tone and the Settlement Outcome All Things XRP presents a scenario in which the lawsuit settles for $50 million under a new SEC chair appointed by President Trump. Also, the commentator suggests that the timing and intensity of the lawsuit under the Biden administration may have had more to do with protecting financial incumbents than safeguarding retail investors. According to the thread, XRP was never eliminated‚Äîit was delayed. The argument concludes that this delay is to protect the profits of legacy banking institutions and payment systems like SWIFT. With SWIFT now handling around $5 trillion per day in transactions, the stakes in maintaining its dominance were considerable. The tweet ends on a forward-looking note, suggesting that those same institutions are now beginning to embrace XRP‚Äôs underlying utility, possibly setting the stage for broader institutional adoption soon. Disclaimer : This content is meant to inform and should not be considered financial advice. The views expressed in this article may include the author‚Äôs personal opinions and do not represent Times Tabloid‚Äôs opinion. Readers are urged to do in-depth research before making any investment decisions. Any action taken by the reader is strictly at their own risk. Times Tabloid is not responsible for any financial losses. title: Revolutionary DeFi Platforms Offer Vital Lifeline to Yemenis Amid Civil War
body: In a world grappling with conflicts and humanitarian crises, innovative solutions often emerge from the most unexpected corners. Yemen, a nation ravaged by civil war, presents a compelling case study in the resilience of the human spirit and the transformative power of decentralized finance (DeFi). As traditional financial systems crumble under the weight of conflict and sanctions, Yemenis are increasingly turning to DeFi platforms as a vital lifeline, offering a glimmer of hope in the face of adversity. Why are Yemenis embracing DeFi Platforms? For years, Yemen has been embroiled in a devastating civil war, exacerbating existing issues of poverty, lack of infrastructure, and limited access to basic services. The latest blow comes in the form of renewed U.S. sanctions targeting the Houthi group, further crippling the nation‚Äôs already fragile financial infrastructure. According to a recent report by TRM Labs, this turmoil is pushing Yemeni citizens towards DeFi platforms at an accelerating rate. But what exactly is driving this shift? Disrupted Traditional Financial Services: The civil war has left Yemen‚Äôs banking sector in tatters. Many banks are either inaccessible due to conflict zones or simply non-functional. This makes it nearly impossible for ordinary citizens to conduct basic financial transactions, receive remittances, or manage their meager savings. Sanctions and Economic Isolation: International sanctions, while aimed at specific groups, often have a ripple effect, impacting the entire population. These measures can further restrict access to global financial networks, making it harder for Yemenis to participate in international trade or receive aid. Limited Access to Centralized Exchanges: While centralized cryptocurrency exchanges (CEXs) offer an alternative to traditional banking, they still operate within regulatory frameworks and can be subject to geopolitical pressures. In regions like Yemen, access to and usability of CEXs can be inconsistent and unreliable. The Appeal of Decentralization: This is where DeFi platforms step in. Decentralized finance, by its very nature, operates outside the control of central authorities and traditional financial institutions. This makes it inherently more resistant to censorship, sanctions, and political instability. The Stark Numbers: DeFi vs. Centralized Exchanges in Yemen The TRM Labs report provides compelling data illustrating the rapid shift towards DeFi in Yemen. Consider these striking statistics: Platform Type Web Traffic Share (Yemen) DeFi Platforms Over 63% Centralized Exchanges 18% These figures paint a clear picture: DeFi platforms are not just a niche alternative; they are becoming the dominant form of cryptocurrency engagement in Yemen. The dramatic difference in web traffic share ‚Äì 63% for DeFi versus a mere 18% for centralized exchanges ‚Äì underscores the urgency and necessity driving this adoption. Challenges to Crypto Adoption in Yemen While the rise of DeFi in Yemen is remarkable, it‚Äôs important to acknowledge the significant hurdles that still exist. Initial crypto adoption in Yemen was slow, hampered by several factors: Poor Internet Access: Reliable internet connectivity is essential for accessing and using DeFi platforms . In Yemen, infrastructure is severely damaged, and internet access remains limited and often unreliable, particularly in conflict-affected areas. Low Financial Literacy: Understanding cryptocurrencies and DeFi requires a certain level of financial and technological literacy. In a country with widespread poverty and limited access to education, navigating the complexities of DeFi can be a significant challenge. Security Concerns: The crypto space, while offering immense potential, is also fraught with risks, including scams, hacks, and volatility. For individuals with limited resources, these risks can be particularly daunting. Regulatory Uncertainty: The legal and regulatory landscape surrounding cryptocurrencies in Yemen, like in many regions experiencing conflict, is likely unclear or non-existent. This lack of clarity can create uncertainty and hinder wider adoption. Benefits of DeFi in Conflict Zones: Beyond Yemen The Yemeni experience offers valuable lessons about the potential of DeFi platforms in conflict zones and regions facing economic hardship. The benefits extend beyond simply providing an alternative financial system: Financial Inclusion: DeFi can provide access to financial services for the unbanked and underbanked populations, a crucial aspect in conflict zones where traditional banks are often absent. Cross-Border Transactions: Crypto adoption facilitates easier and potentially cheaper cross-border transactions, vital for remittances and humanitarian aid delivery. Transparency and Traceability: Blockchain technology, the foundation of DeFi, offers enhanced transparency and traceability of transactions, which can be beneficial for aid distribution and reducing corruption. Empowerment and Resilience: By giving individuals greater control over their finances, DeFi can foster a sense of empowerment and financial resilience in communities facing immense challenges. Examples of DeFi Use Cases in Yemen While specific on-the-ground examples are still emerging, we can envision how DeFi platforms are likely being utilized in Yemen: Remittances: Yemenis abroad can send remittances to family members back home using stablecoins and DeFi protocols, potentially bypassing traditional, expensive, and unreliable remittance channels. Local P2P Exchanges: Decentralized exchanges can facilitate peer-to-peer trading of cryptocurrencies within Yemen, enabling local economic activity despite the collapse of formal markets. Aid Distribution: Humanitarian organizations could potentially leverage DeFi for more efficient and transparent distribution of aid directly to those in need, reducing leakage and ensuring funds reach their intended recipients. Savings and Asset Preservation: In an environment of hyperinflation and currency devaluation, cryptocurrencies, despite their volatility, can offer a store of value and a means to preserve savings. Actionable Insights: What Can Be Done to Support DeFi Adoption in Yemen? The story of crypto adoption in Yemen is still unfolding, but its potential to alleviate suffering and empower communities is undeniable. To further support this positive trend, several actionable steps can be considered: Improve Internet Access: Investing in infrastructure to improve internet connectivity in Yemen is paramount. This will not only facilitate DeFi adoption but also support education, communication, and economic development in general. Promote Financial Literacy: Educational initiatives focused on digital literacy and financial literacy, specifically tailored to the Yemeni context, are crucial to empower citizens to safely and effectively utilize DeFi tools. Develop User-Friendly DeFi Solutions: Creating DeFi applications and platforms that are specifically designed to be user-friendly for individuals with limited technical expertise and potentially low internet bandwidth is essential. International Support and Collaboration: International organizations and the global crypto community can play a vital role in providing resources, technical assistance, and funding to support DeFi initiatives in Yemen and similar conflict-affected regions. Conclusion: A Beacon of Hope in a Time of Crisis The increasing reliance on DeFi platforms in Yemen is more than just a technological trend; it‚Äôs a testament to human adaptability and the enduring quest for financial freedom, even amidst the horrors of civil war. While challenges remain, the data is clear: DeFi is providing a vital lifeline, offering a glimmer of hope and a path towards greater financial inclusion for Yemenis in their time of critical need. This situation underscores the revolutionary potential of decentralized finance to empower individuals and communities facing systemic disruptions and humanitarian crises worldwide. The Yemeni experience serves as a powerful reminder that innovation, even in the darkest of times, can offer pathways to resilience and recovery. To learn more about the latest DeFi trends, explore our article on key developments shaping DeFi adoption globally.

title: a16z-backed Balance secures Binance Alpha and Futures listing ahead of TGE
body: EPT, the native token of Balance, an AI-powered Web3 gaming and social platform, is set to debut on Binance‚Äôs Alpha and Futures platforms next week. Binance‚Äôs announcement comes ahead of the project‚Äôs long-awaited Token Generation Event, which is expected to take place shortly before the listings go live. While the exact timing hasn‚Äôt been confirmed, the Balance team hinted in an X post on April 14 that the TGE is ‚Äújust around the corner.‚Äù As per Binance‚Äôs official announcement on April 18, EPT will go live on Binance Alpha on April 21 at 12:00 PM UTC. Binance Alpha is an early-access feature within the Binance Wallet that highlights promising Web3 projects before they hit the main exchange. It acts as a curated discovery zone for new tokens, offering users a first look at emerging crypto assets. You might also like: TAO reclaims key support following 13% rally, more gains ahead? Selections are based on Binance‚Äôs internal research and market expertise, focusing on projects that show strong momentum, active communities, and relevance to current industry trends. However, being featured on Alpha does not guarantee a future spot listing on Binance. Alongside the Binance Alpha listing, the exchange will list the EPT/USDT pair on its Futures platform , allowing investors to trade with up to 20x leverage. Further, Binance will airdrop 3,500 EPT to celebrate the launch on its platforms to eligible users who purchased tokens using Spot or Funding wallets on Alpha between April 11 and 17. The tokens will be distributed to their Binance Alpha accounts by April 21, 12:10 PM UTC. What is Balance? Launched in May 2024, Balance is a Web3 gaming and social platform created by the team behind E-PAL, a Web2 gaming companion platform boasting over 4.2 million users and 450,000 active companions called EPALs. The platform aims to bridge Web2 and Web3 by integrating AI-driven social features with a growing catalogue of over 180 supported games and partnerships across 80+ Web3 gaming projects. It offers a layered ecosystem that includes AI companions, NFT infrastructure, and tools tailored for both creators and players. EPT serves as the governance token within the Balance ecosystem, incentivising activities such as transactions, liquidity provision, and application creation. In September 2024, Balance raised $30 million from investors such as a16z, Animoca Brands, Galaxy Interactive, Amber Group, and DWF Labs to develop its Web3 infrastructure. title: Trader Says Altcoin That‚Äôs Ripped 222% in a Month Still Has Room To Run, Updates Outlook on SOL-Based Memecoin

This is either charging up for a big move up to $1.25 or it‚Äôs going to pullback, I don‚Äôt have a clue where it goes in the short term. What I do know, however, is that this thing is going to go higher later on.‚Äù Source: Altcoin Sherpa/X Looking at his chart, the trader suggests FARTCOIN make another attempt to break through resistance at $0.96. Many strong alts have been in this range for about one month at this point. title: Why XRP could rally 100% even in a crypto crash
body: XRP rallied 2% in the past week, and nearly 1% on the day, bucking the typical trend of correction in the crypto market. The second-largest altcoin by market capitalization ranks among the top 10 gainers, according to Grayscale data. XRP (XRP) is the third-largest cryptocurrency by market capitalization and is the only altcoin with positive year-to-date gains, compared to Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), and other tokens. XRP trades at $2.0615 at the time of writing. Table of Contents XRP leads top 10 cryptos in year-to-date gains Bullish catalysts could push XRP price higher XRP price prediction, 100% gains likely On-chain and derivatives analysis Ripple‚Äôs latest institutional push, XRP set to gain XRP leads top 10 cryptos in year-to-date gains Grayscale analyzed the year-to-date returns of the top 10 cryptocurrencies, and XRP led the group with a positive 0.2%. The remainder of the nine cryptos have plummeted in the same timeframe, while XRP holds on to gains. XRP price is up 278.95% in the last six months and the altcoin buck the downward trend in altcoins and Bitcoin, and Liberation Day decline in prices. XRP shows resilience with 1.6% weekly returns and a market capitalization of $125.8 billion, as noted by the asset management giant. 1 week crypto returns for top 10 cryptocurrencies | Source: Grayscale You might also like: U.S. stocks mixed as Trump calls for Fed to act Bullish catalysts could push XRP price higher The resolution of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission‚Äôs lawsuit against Ripple propelled the altcoin back to its position as the second-largest altcoin. For years XRP slipped lower in the ranks, while Ethereum alternatives and meme coins challenged its position in the top 10 cryptos. The $50 million settlement between the SEC and Ripple closed the litigation for the firm and catalyzed a massive rally in XRP price. The regulatory clarity from the Trump administration lifted a cloud from XRP‚Äôs muted performance and sparked a renewed interest in the altcoin from market participants. The number of active addresses on the XRP chain climbed from 16,826 prior to Trump‚Äôs return (pre-election) to over 100,000 at its peak in December 2024. Ripple and its executives have strategically increased their influence in Washington DC through its donations to Political Action Committees, a close relationship with the Trump administration and XRP‚Äôs mention in the list of potential assets to be included in a strategic crypto stockpile in the U.S. Several XRP ETF proposals have been filed and appear to be strong contenders for approval in 2025, emerging as another catalyst for the altcoin. XRP could post nearly 120% gains and climb to a peak of $4.5041. The MACD flashes green histogram bars, signaling an underlying upward trend in XRP price. RSI is hovering close to the neutral level, at 46. On-chain and derivatives analysis On-chain indicators support further gains in XRP. Santiment data shows that the funding rate on Binance is positive, meaning short positions are paying for longs and there is a likelihood of XRP price rallying. Network realized profit and loss metric that identifies the net profit/loss of all tokens that were moved on a given day reads 4.41 million in losses. XRP traders have shed their holdings at losses, however this appears to be limited to retail participants, as whale transactions valued at $100,000 and higher and $1 million and higher. This is above the 2025 average and the altcoin is relevant among derivatives traders. title: RWA Blockchain Converge Turns to Arbitrum and Celestia for High Speeds, Low Costs
body: DeFi protocol Ethena and real-world asset (RWA) tokenization firm Securitize have chosen Arbitrum and Celestia to power their new Converge blockchain. Ethena and Securitize plan to move their tokenized asset products onto Converge once the Layer 1 blockchain launches its mainnet. The institutional-focused blockchain requires high speed and security to attract institutional clients with billions in real-world assets (RWA) to tokenize. To achieve this, Ethena and Securitize will use Arbitrum‚Äôs high-performance Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) while leveraging Celestia for data availability. title: DeFi Adoption Rises in Sanction-Hit Yemen, Crypto as a Lifeline?
body: Yemen, a country long ravaged by civil war and economic instability, has witnessed cryptocurrencies‚Äîonce dismissed as speculative tools‚Äîquietly becoming essential lifelines. A new report by blockchain intelligence firm TRM Labs reveals a surge in decentralized finance (DeFi) usage among Yemen citizens, particularly in the wake of U.S. sanctions targeting the Houthi group, a faction now officially relisted as a terrorist organization by the U.S. government. Yemen People Turn to DeFi for Financial Survival Historically, Yemen‚Äôs crypto adoption has been hampered by unreliable internet infrastructure and limited digital literacy. But that is changing. TRM Labs notes a shift driven not by hype or FOMO, but by urgent necessity. ‚ÄúThe ability to bypass the disruption in local financial services offers a modicum of financial resilience,‚Äù the report states, highlighting the increasingly vital role that crypto is playing in the daily lives of Yemenis. With many banks inoperable or inaccessible due to the ongoing conflict, DeFi platforms have emerged as the most visited crypto-related services in the region, accounting for over 63% of observed activity. Centralized exchanges, by comparison, make up just 18% of the traffic. The rest comes from peer-to-peer (P2P) transactions, often used for cross-border remittances or moving funds away from surveillance. How U.S. Policies May Be Fueling Crypto Uptake The link between geopolitical action and digital financial behavior is particularly evident in Yemen. Following the Biden administration‚Äôs decision in January 2024 to relist the Houthis as a Specially Designated Global Terrorist group, a local Yemen-based crypto exchange saw its volume skyrocket by 270%. Though the spike eventually cooled, another significant 223% increase followed after Donald Trump was re-elected and reaffirmed the Houthi group‚Äôs terror designation. While the majority of Yemen crypto users appear to be everyday citizens seeking access to stable financial tools, TRM Labs warns that more sophisticated usage could be on the horizon. As sanctions tighten and international banking routes close, the Houthis and their backers‚Äîsuch as Iran‚Äîcould increasingly turn to crypto for funding. In a region where financial access is fractured, and traditional banking channels are either failing or restricted, decentralized finance is emerging not just as a workaround‚Äîbut as a necessity. The post DeFi Adoption Rises in Sanction-Hit Yemen, Crypto as a Lifeline? appeared first on TheCoinrise.com .

title: Relief Rally? Trump Hints at Easing China Tariffs, Crypto Market Eyes Positive Shift
body: In a surprising turn of events that has global markets on edge, former U.S. President Donald Trump has indicated a potential softening stance on tariffs against China. This news arrives as a welcome sign for many, especially those in the cryptocurrency market, who are keenly observing how geopolitical tensions influence market sentiment and investment strategies. Could this be the relief the global economy and crypto markets have been waiting for? Let‚Äôs dive into the details of Trump‚Äôs recent statements and what they might mean for the future of trade and digital assets. Why Trump‚Äôs Tariff Comments Matter to the Global Economy For years, the world has witnessed a tense back-and-forth between the U.S. and China, largely characterized by escalating Trump tariffs on various goods. These tariffs, imposed under the Trump administration, were aimed at reshaping trade balances and protecting American industries. However, they‚Äôve also sparked concerns about inflation, supply chain disruptions, and overall economic instability. Trump‚Äôs recent remarks suggest a potential shift away from this aggressive tariff policy. According to Reuters, Trump stated, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want them to go higher because at a certain point you make it where people don‚Äôt buy.‚Äù This acknowledgment that high tariffs can backfire by suppressing consumer demand is a significant departure from his previous rhetoric and could signal a major policy adjustment. The Potential Benefits of Easing the China Trade War If Trump follows through with his hint to lower or halt tariff increases, the benefits could be widespread. Here are a few key advantages to consider: Reduced Inflationary Pressures: Tariffs are essentially taxes on imported goods, which are often passed on to consumers in the form of higher prices. Lowering tariffs could help ease inflationary pressures, a major concern for economies worldwide. Boosted Consumer Spending: As Trump himself pointed out, high tariffs can deter consumer spending. Lower prices on goods could stimulate demand, benefiting businesses and the economy as a whole. Improved Business Confidence: The uncertainty surrounding the China trade war has been a drag on business investment. A move towards de-escalation could boost business confidence, encouraging investment and expansion. Strengthened Global Trade Relations: Easing trade tensions could improve diplomatic relations and foster a more stable global trade environment, benefiting all participating nations. Challenges and Uncertainties Ahead While the prospect of easing tariffs is promising, it‚Äôs crucial to acknowledge the potential challenges and uncertainties: Political Volatility: Trump‚Äôs statements are just hints at this stage. Policy can change rapidly, and there‚Äôs no guarantee that tariffs will actually be lowered or even remain stable. Political developments can swiftly alter the trade landscape. Existing Trade Imbalances: Even with reduced tariffs, underlying trade imbalances between the U.S. and China may persist. Addressing these long-term issues will require more than just tariff adjustments. Geopolitical Tensions: Trade is just one aspect of the complex relationship between the U.S. and China. Other geopolitical tensions could still impact economic stability and tariff impact indirectly. Market Reactions: While initial market reactions to Trump‚Äôs comments might be positive, sustained positive sentiment will depend on concrete actions and policy changes. Examples of Tariff Impact and Market Reactions To understand the real-world implications, let‚Äôs consider some examples of how tariffs have previously affected markets: Event Impact on Markets Example Imposition of Tariffs in 2018 Market Volatility, Sector-Specific Impacts The initial imposition of tariffs in 2018 led to significant stock market volatility and negatively impacted sectors heavily reliant on international trade. Escalation of Trade Tensions in 2019 Slowed Global Growth, Supply Chain Disruptions The escalation in 2019 contributed to a slowdown in global economic growth and caused disruptions in supply chains as businesses scrambled to adjust. Potential Tariff Reduction (Future) Positive Market Sentiment, Potential Economic Boost If tariffs are indeed reduced, we could see a boost in market sentiment , increased investment, and potentially stronger economic growth. Actionable Insights for Crypto Investors For cryptocurrency investors, understanding the implications of potential tariff changes is vital. Here are some actionable insights: Monitor Global Economic News: Keep a close eye on developments related to trade policy and the global economy . These macroeconomic factors can significantly influence crypto market trends. Assess Risk Appetite: Trade policy shifts can introduce volatility. Assess your risk appetite and adjust your portfolio accordingly. Diversification remains key in uncertain times. Watch for Market Sentiment Shifts: Pay attention to how market sentiment reacts to trade news. Positive signals could indicate potential upward trends in crypto markets, while negative signals might suggest caution. Consider Geopolitical Factors: Remember that trade is just one piece of the geopolitical puzzle. Broader geopolitical events can also impact market stability and investor confidence. Conclusion: A Glimmer of Hope for Global Markets? Trump‚Äôs recent comments offer a glimmer of hope that the era of escalating tariffs might be nearing an end. For the cryptocurrency market and the broader global economy, this could represent a significant positive shift. However, it‚Äôs crucial to remain vigilant and informed, as policy landscapes can change rapidly. The potential easing of the China trade war could unlock new opportunities and foster a more stable economic environment, but it‚Äôs essential to approach this development with cautious optimism and a well-informed investment strategy. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action.

title: sUSD Drops Below $0.7 as Synthetix Stablecoin Faces Prolonged Depeg
body: The algorithmic stablecoin sUSD, a cornerstone of the Synthetix ecosystem, has spiraled into its deepest depeg in years, tumbling below $0.7 amid mounting concerns over its collateral mechanism and liquidity crunch. This latest drop marks a stark deterioration from its already fragile state earlier this month, when it wobbled near $0.83. A System Under Stress Data from CoinGecko shows sUSD‚Äôs highest price in the last seven days at $0.9032. However, since April 14, it has dropped steadily, going to $0.86, then to $0.76, before finally hitting rock bottom on April 18 at $0.664. At the time of writing, the stablecoin had regained nearly 2% of its value in the last hour, although the current price of $0.70 is still an 8.8% dip in 24 hours. Its performance across longer time frames is just as bad, down 29.3% over 30 days and 29.2% year-on-year. The situation is no better with sUSD‚Äôs Optimism version. It hit a new all-time low of $0.6476 hours ago, after going down 6.9% in the past day and 32.7% over the previous month, raising fears of a potential death spiral reminiscent of Terra‚Äôs UST collapse. Meanwhile, a modest 0.5% uptick in the price of Synthetix‚Äôs native SNX token has not stopped it from plummeting almost 26% in the last 30 days and 77% from its yearly high. Cascading Risks sUSD is designed to maintain a 1:1 peg with the U.S. dollar and is backed by staked SNX tokens under a collateralized debt model. However, the recent passage of SIP 420, a protocol overhaul aimed at improving capital efficiency, seems to have inadvertently destabilized the stablecoin. The update slashed the collateralization ratio from 750% to 200% and transitioned to a collective debt pool, removing a key arbitrage mechanism: stakers can no longer profit from buying depegged sUSD to repay discounted debts. It has seemingly resulted in a vacuum of buy-side demand. As Okto Chain‚Äôs Minal Thukral noted , the absence of a peg stability module has left sUSD vulnerable to sustained sell pressure, with liquidity thinning and concentrated AMM pools only exacerbating price swings. The crypto community is divided on the issue. While some maintain that Synthetix‚Äôs treasury, which holds about $30 million in sUSD and other assets, could act as a backstop to stem the tide, others see little reason to hold sUSD without a clear repeg plan. Even Synthetix founder Kain Warwick seems to have embraced the dark humor of the moment, renaming his X account to ‚Äúkain.depeg.‚Äù The post sUSD Drops Below $0.7 as Synthetix Stablecoin Faces Prolonged Depeg appeared first on CryptoPotato .

title: Bitcoin Undermined by Gold as Investors Seek Traditional Safe Havens
body: JPMorgan analysts say Bitcoin has failed to meet expectations as a safe-haven asset, as gold and traditional assets attract inflows amid global uncertainty. Gold Outshines Bitcoin During Market Turbulence JPMorgan‚Äôs latest research casts fresh doubt on Bitcoin‚Äôs role as a reliable safe-haven asset, highlighting gold‚Äôs continued dominance in times of economic uncertainty. The banking giant‚Äôs analysts noted that, while investors have flocked to gold and other traditional safe havens like the Japanese yen and Swiss franc, Bitcoin has seen consistent outflows and diminished demand. Gold exchange-traded funds (ETFs) registered $21.1 billion in net inflows globally in Q1 2025, according to World Gold Council data cited in the report. Of this, $2.3 billion originated from China and Hong Kong alone ‚Äî a region that accounted for 16% of total gold ETF assets under management. In contrast, Bitcoin ETFs have seen three consecutive months of outflows, indicating a stark divergence in investor sentiment. Speculative Appetite for Bitcoin Wanes The report, led by JPMorgan managing director Nikolaos Panigirtzoglou, emphasized that Bitcoin‚Äôs recent performance has been hindered by waning speculative interest. This is evident not only in ETF outflows but also in declining activity in Bitcoin futures markets. Analysts wrote, ‚ÄúDespite a decline in market breadth and liquidity, gold continues to benefit from safe haven flows in a similar fashion to currencies like the Swiss franc and the yen. These safe haven flows are seen in both the ETF and futures spaces.‚Äù The analysts attributed gold‚Äôs resurgence to mounting macroeconomic and geopolitical uncertainties, which typically push investors toward more stable assets. Bitcoin, which has long been touted by some as ‚Äúdigital gold,‚Äù is not currently reflecting those characteristics. Bitcoin‚Äôs Volatility Undermines ‚ÄòDigital Gold‚Äô Narrative JPMorgan‚Äôs skepticism around Bitcoin as a safe haven echoes concerns raised in an earlier report this month, where analysts flagged the cryptocurrency‚Äôs high volatility and close correlation with equities as key weaknesses. The report claimed, ‚ÄúThe volatility of Bitcoin and its correlation with the stock market raises questions about the narrative of Bitcoin as 'digital gold'.‚Äù Currently, Bitcoin has underperformed gold by approximately 29% in 2025, reinforcing doubts among skeptics. Canadian billionaire Frank Giustra recently commented that Bitcoin ‚Äúhas never traded like gold,‚Äù a sentiment that appears increasingly validated by recent data. Diverging Views on Bitcoin‚Äôs Dual Role Despite JPMorgan‚Äôs critical stance, some market participants maintain that Bitcoin can exhibit both risk-on and risk-off properties depending on broader market dynamics. Fundstrat‚Äôs Tom Lee, for instance, has characterized Bitcoin as ‚Äúambidextrous,‚Äù capable of adapting to varying investor moods. However, the current trend appears firmly tilted toward traditional assets. JPMorgan also identified $62,000 as a key support level for Bitcoin in the near term, though its ability to reclaim ground as a safe-haven asset remains uncertain. Disclaimer: This article is provided for informational purposes only. It is not offered or intended to be used as legal, tax, investment, financial, or other advice

body: Crypto history is filled with moments investors wish they hadn‚Äôt ignored. One of the most iconic examples? But those opportunities are rare‚Äîand more importantly, they‚Äôre often only recognized in hindsight. Now in 2025, a new project is quietly gaining early momentum‚ÄîMutuum Finance (MUTM). But this time, the opportunity doesn‚Äôt rely on memes or momentum. Instead, it‚Äôs built around functionality, on-chain structure, and real progress. And while the presale price sits at just $0.025, investors who understand the fundamentals are already acting before it breaks out. Mutuum Finance (MUTM) At this moment, Mutuum Finance is in the middle of its presale‚Äîpriced at $0.025 with the next stage already scheduled to jump to $0.03. That means those buying in now are securing a 20% gain before the token even hits exchanges. More importantly, over 8,300 on-chain holders have already joined, and more than $6.8 million has been raised. This isn‚Äôt a speculative meme play. It‚Äôs a case of a project being built from the ground up with long-term mechanics and a fully transparent rollout. And unlike meme coins that rely solely on community hype, Mutuum‚Äôs demand curve is backed by actual protocol activity. This means once the token lists publicly, the price isn‚Äôt just expected to rise‚Äîit‚Äôs structurally designed to. Shiba inu (SHIB) For comparison, Shiba Inu (SHIB) surged on the back of viral exposure and speculative fervor. From $0.00001, it climbed to $0.000089, creating nearly 8x gains during its prime. But SHIB‚Äôs rise wasn‚Äôt tied to ecosystem development or utility at the time‚Äîit was a momentum play. That made it volatile, and its correction was just as sharp. MUTM Is Doing It Differently Mutuum Finance isn‚Äôt aiming to go viral overnight. Instead, the team is quietly building a platform that enables decentralized borrowing and lending‚Äîwhile preserving user ownership of assets and putting real yield back into their hands. One of the key features is the use of mtTokens‚Äîtokenized versions of deposits that automatically reflect both the initial value and the interest earned over time. Instead of relying on token emissions or inflationary rewards, mtTokens accumulate real-time value based on lending activity. This offers users full control and transparency over their earnings. The system also avoids the need for centralized control. All deposits stay in audited smart contracts, and users can withdraw at any time‚Äîassuming the protocol has available liquidity. title: North Korean Hackers Suspected in Zoom Attack on Manta Executive
body: The call featured a seemingly real video of people he knows, and he suspects the attack was linked to North Korea‚Äôs Lazarus Group. Developers are also being targeted by another North Korean group through fake job offers and malware-laced coding tests hosted on GitHub. Meanwhile, Ethereum Name Service founder Nick Johnson warned about a highly convincing phishing email campaign impersonating Google, which uses Google Sites and DKIM-authenticated alerts to harvest user credentials. Manta Exec Targeted in Zoom Scam Manta Network co-founder Kenny Li revealed he was the target of an advanced phishing attack that used a realistic Zoom call and live recordings of familiar people to lure him into downloading malware. In an April 17 post on X , Li shared more details about the incident, and said that everything about the Zoom meeting appeared authentic, including the video feed of someone he knew, but the audio was missing and a suspicious prompt appeared urging him to update Zoom by downloading a script file. This immediately raised alarm bells, which pushed him to exit the call. After the Zoom session, Li tried to verify the person's identity via a Telegram call, but the impersonator refused, deleted all previous messages, and blocked him. He later shared screenshots of the interaction, which included a suggestion from him to move the meeting to Google Meet, which the attacker ignored. Li suspects the North Korean state-sponsored Lazarus Group was behind the attempted attack and believes that the real person's account was compromised. In an interview, Li placed a lot of emphasis on the fact that the video footage seemed genuine, not AI-generated, and resembled standard webcam quality. He believes the attackers used old recordings of actual team members to simulate a live call. The Manta executive warned others in the crypto space to be especially cautious of any unexpected requests to download files , and described these kinds of prompts as a major red flag. He also wanted people about just how emotionally manipulative and mentally taxing these attacks can be, particularly for busy executives that are used to spontaneous calls and messages. Other people in the crypto community reported experiencing similar scams. A member of ContributionDAO recounted how attackers tried to force a Zoom installation via a custom link, claiming it was a business-only version, and declined to switch platforms when asked to use Google Meet. Additionally, crypto researcher ‚Äú Meekdonald‚Äù shared that someone close to them fell for an identical scam that Li narrowly escaped. North Korean Hackers Target Crypto Devs The North Korean hackers linked to the $1.4 billion Bybit exploit are now also reportedly targeting cryptocurrency developers through a deceptive recruitment campaign involving fake coding tests that are embedded with malware. According to cybersecurity outlet The Hacker News , developers are being approached by people posing as recruiters, primarily through LinkedIn. These imposters offer enticing job opportunities and eventually send over a GitHub-hosted document that contains a supposed coding assignment. Once opened, the file installs stealer malware capable of compromising the developer‚Äôs device and gaining access to sensitive information. (Source: Hacker News ) The malicious campaign is attributed to the North Korean state-backed hacking group known as Slow Pisces, which is also referred to as Jade Sleet, Pukchong, TraderTraitor, and UNC4899. The primary goal of these attackers seems to be stealing credentials, SSH keys, iCloud Keychain contents, wallet access, API keys, and cloud configurations. These tools are then used to breach the employer‚Äôs infrastructure and identify vulnerabilities for future exploits. Security experts, including Hakan Unal of Cyvers and Luis Lubeck of Hacken, explained how these attackers build credible profiles on professional platforms like LinkedIn, and sometimes extend their activities to freelance platforms like Upwork and Fiverr. The scammers often present themselves as clients or hiring managers offering lucrative roles, especially in DeFi or Web3 security, to make the offers seem legitimate. (Source: Hacker News ) Hayato Shigekawa from Chainalysis pointed out that hackers even go as far as creating realistic resumes and employee personas to trick developers. Their ultimate objective is to gain a foothold in the target company through compromised developer credentials. Once inside, they conduct reconnaissance to identify and exploit weaknesses in the system. Cybersecurity professionals warned that developers should be extremely cautious when receiving unsolicited job offers or assignments. Yehor Rudytsia from Hacken stressed that attackers are evolving, and are using both psychological and technical tactics to bypass defenses. To minimize risks, developers are advised to use virtual machines and sandboxes for testing unknown code, verify the legitimacy of job offers through official channels, and avoid running or installing unverified code. Storing sensitive information securely and using robust endpoint protection can also serve as critical lines of defense. Fake Google Alerts Trick Users Nick Johnson, the founder and lead developer of Ethereum Name Service (ENS), also recently issued a warning about an extremely sophisticated phishing attack that impersonates Google and tricks users into revealing their login credentials. In an April 16 post on X , Johnson explained that the attack sends a fake security alert, claiming the user‚Äôs Google data is being shared with law enforcement due to a subpoena. The phishing email looks highly convincing, passing Google's DKIM signature check and showing up in Gmail alongside legitimate security alerts without any warning indicators. The scam lures users into clicking a link to ‚Äúview case materials‚Äù or protest the data request. The link leads to a Google Sites page‚Äîhosted on a Google subdomain‚Äîwhich increases its credibility. Johnson explained that while he didn‚Äôt follow the process all the way through, the goal is likely to harvest login credentials and compromise the user‚Äôs account. Though the use of Google‚Äôs domain name adds legitimacy to the scam, there are still some red flags , like the email being forwarded from a private address. According to a recent report by software firm EasyDMARC, the attack exploits Google Sites and the OAuth app infrastructure, allowing scammers to craft emails that seem to come from a genuine ‚Äúno-reply@google‚Äù address while masking the true reply address. (Source: X ) Because DKIM only verifies the message and headers but not the envelope, these emails pass Gmail‚Äôs validation checks and appear as authentic messages. According to Johnson, this loophole allows phishing emails to be threaded into conversations with real Google alerts, making detection even more difficult. Google acknowledged the threat and confirmed that it is working on countermeasures. A spokesperson said that the company is shutting down the mechanism allowing the inclusion of arbitrary-length text in the message, which will prevent the current form of the attack. Google also identified the threat actor behind the campaign as ‚ÄùRockfoils‚Äù and said that protective measures were rolled out over the past week, with full deployment expected soon.

title: KiloEx DEX exploiter returns $1.4M out of the $7M stolen funds
body: The hacker behind KiloEx‚Äôs recent $7.4 million exploit has returned $1.4 million worth of USDT following days of silence. The update was shared by blockchain security firm PeckShield in an Apr. 18 post on X, confirming that funds linked to the attack were sent back to KiloEx‚Äôs address. KiloEx, a decentralized perpetuals trading platform backed by YZi Labs, was hacked on Apr. 15 in a cross-chain attack that targeted Base, opBNB, and BNB Chain ( BNB ). #PeckShieldAlert #KiloEx exploiter -labeled addresses has returned ~1.4M #USDT to #KiloEx https://t.co/SijPGua1ur pic.twitter.com/rPKAJtdWm2 ‚Äî PeckShieldAlert (@PeckShieldAlert) April 18, 2025 The exploit was first flagged by Cyvers Alerts, which linked the incident to a wallet funded via Tornado Cash. A price oracle vulnerability was the main cause, enabling the attacker to manipulate ETH/USD values and use inflated prices to drain funds. The losses were distributed among Base ($3.3M), opBNB ($3.1M), and BSC ($1M), per PeckShield‚Äôs breakdown. You might also like: ZK token crashes after $5m airdrop exploit confirmed by ZKsync KiloEx DEX gave the attacker a 72-hour ultimatum and offered a whitehat bounty of 10% of the stolen money in exchange for returning the remaining amount. ‚ÄúWe are actively monitoring your addresses‚Ä¶ and are prepared to freeze the stolen funds promptly,‚Äù the team warned. When the hacker failed to respond, KiloEx filed a formal case with Hong Kong police on Apr. 17 and partnered with cybersecurity firm SlowMist to support the investigation. The company said it had already shared critical data with law enforcement and will release a full incident report once the probe progresses. Dear KiloEx Users, We would like to update you on the latest developments regarding the April 15th hacker incident. 1. We have reported the incident to the Hong Kong police, and a formal case has been filed. KiloEx is working with both the Criminal Division and the Cybercrime‚Ä¶ ‚Äî KiloEx (@KiloEx_perp) April 17, 2025 While the returned amount falls short of the 90% target, the transaction suggests some progress. KiloEx has not yet confirmed receipt of the funds or whether further negotiations are ongoing. The platform is currently working to restore trading operations and finalize a user compensation plan. It also assured users that open positions will be settled based on pre-attack prices, with no risk of forced liquidation. Read more: Crypto hacks in Q1 soar 131% YoY as losses hit $1.63b, data shows
