title: Hashkey takes aim at XRP ETF in Asia with new fund backed by Ripple
body: Hong Kong-based crypto investment firm HashKey Capital announced the launch of an XRP fund, with plans to convert it into an exchange-traded fund (ETF) in the future. According to an April 18 announcement , the fund, officially titled the HashKey XRP Tracker Fund, is reportedly ‚Äúthe first investment fund in Asia designed to track the performance of XRP.‚Äù XRP developer Ripple will serve as the fund‚Äôs anchor investor. In a separate X post , HashKey Capital said the fund aims to bring ‚Äúmore institutional capital into regulated XRP products and the broader digital asset ecosystem.‚Äù Close collaboration with Ripple In another X post , HashKey Capital said the fund marks the beginning of a closer collaboration with Ripple. The two firms ‚Äúare exploring new investment products, cross-border DeFi solutions, and tokenization ‚Äîincluding the possibility of launching a money market fund (MMF) on the XRP ledger.‚Äù Related: Ripple vs. XRP vs. XRP Ledger: What‚Äôs the difference? In the announcement, HashKey Capital partner Vivien Wong said the firm will share its connections with financial institutions, regulators and investors in Asia with Ripple, adding: ‚ÄúRipple offers us the opportunity to collaborate on more investment products and solutions across cross-border payment solutions, decentralized finance (DeFi), and enterprise blockchain adoption.‚Äù A Hong Kong XRP ETF in the works? The XRP ( XRP ) Tracker Fund is HashKey Capital‚Äôs third tracker fund and follows the firm‚Äôs Bitcoin ( BTC ) and Ether ( ETH ) ETF products. The company noted that this product may also become an ETF in the future. Source: HashKey Capital Related: XRP: Why it‚Äôs outperforming altcoins ‚Äî and what comes next A boon for XRP‚Äôs institutional adoption in Asia Hank Huang, CEO of Kronos Research, a crypto investment firm based in Asia, told Cointelegraph that ‚Äúthe launch of the XRP Tracker Fund by HashKey Capital marks a pivotal moment for institutional adoption‚Äù in the region. He said regulated and transparent products like Hashkey‚Äôs fund are what institutional investors need to enter the market. ‚ÄúXRP‚Äôs proven use case in cross-border payments, combined with HashKey‚Äôs robust infrastructure, sets the stage for meaningful capital inflows and wider acceptance of crypto assets in global finance,‚Äú Huang said. Magazine: XRP win leaves Ripple and industry with no crypto legal precedent set

title: Unpacking Bitcoin‚Äôs On-Chain Trends
body: There are two types of analysis in finance: technical and fundamental. The first focuses on price patterns and considers an asset‚Äôs volatility and volume to assess the possibility of price movement in a particular direction. The second, fundamental analysis, is used to appraise an asset‚Äôs intrinsic value. Fundamental analysis in traditional finance uses formal documents such as company reports. These can be of different types: earnings reports, job hiring reports, tax reports, etc. Expanding into new markets can also be viewed as part of it, as it suggests increased production and consumer growth. The emergence of cryptocurrencies brings its own advantages, which influence the traditional financial system as well. On-chain analysis tracks user activity on the blockchain. We cannot know exactly how many bank customers transferred their funds yesterday to another particular bank. With crypto ‚Äî yes, we can. But we don‚Äôt know who it was exactly, which is probably for the best. Although considered a part of fundamental analysis, on-chain analysis has its own perks, and let‚Äôs move on and have a quick look over the past few weeks at Bitcoin‚Äôs blockchain activity. There are two types of HODLers (a.k.a. holders): short-term HODLers (STHs) and long-term HODLers (LTHs). As of now, when Bitcoin price is continuing to oscillate around $85,000, STHs‚Äô assets in loss have peaked at 3.4 million, comparable to July 2018, the post-bull-run period. Around 90% of all the STHs who have held for at least a month are now underwater. It is worth mentioning that STHs, due to their recent buy-ins, bear the most losses when correction phases begin, making them the most vulnerable to market disruptions. Since Bitcoin‚Äôs latest all-time high (ATH) at $109K, their combined realized profit and loss has dropped by 85% ‚Äî from $3.4 billion to approximately $508 million. Another key metric to follow is the miner reserve. Miners are the source of Bitcoin. As they mine, they accumulate Bitcoin in their wallets. Miners are highly sensitive to once-in-four-years halvings when their rewards are cut in half, and to electricity costs, as they consume a lot. When the price is favorable and allows them to cover mining and maintenance costs, they distribute coins and create selling pressure. Every time Bitcoin reaches an ATH, they sell their assets. This week, we‚Äôve seen a small rebound in miner reserves, with more than 1,300 Bitcoin accumulated ‚Äî modest but steady growth. However, overall on-chain activity remains weak, with 900,000 active addresses compared to the February peak of 1,200,000. The coming months will reveal whether Bitcoin and the broader crypto market will be able to attract new investors ‚Äî the only way a bull phase can persist. The recent introduction of Bitcoin ETPs by BlackRock to European customers, OKX being the first crypto exchange obtaining the MiFID II license in accordance with the MiCA framework, may pave the way for increased capital inflows. All eyes are on European markets.

title: Relief for KiloEx: $1.4M Returned After Shocking $7M Crypto Exploit ‚Äì DeFi Security Spotlight
body: In a surprising turn of events in the volatile world of decentralized finance (DeFi), the exploiter behind the recent $7 million breach of perpetual decentralized exchange KiloEx (KILO) has begun to return a portion of the stolen funds. Blockchain security firm PeckShield reported on X that approximately $1.4 million USDT has been sent back to the platform. This partial fund recovery offers a glimmer of hope amidst ongoing concerns about DeFi security and the risks associated with crypto exploit vulnerabilities. What Happened with the KiloEx Crypto Exploit? On April 15th, KiloEx, a decentralized exchange known for its perpetual contract offerings, fell victim to a sophisticated security breach. This crypto exploit resulted in a staggering loss of around $7 million, sending shockwaves through the DeFi community. Such incidents underscore the persistent challenges in maintaining robust DeFi security measures within the rapidly evolving cryptocurrency landscape. Here‚Äôs a quick breakdown of the key events: The Breach: KiloEx experienced a security exploit on April 15th. Significant Losses: Approximately $7 million was siphoned from the platform. Community Concern: The incident raised fresh questions about the safety of funds on decentralized exchanges. Partial Recovery: Around $1.4 million USDT has been returned by the exploiter. Why is Fund Recovery a Big Deal in Crypto Exploits? In the often-anonymous and irreversible world of cryptocurrency transactions, any fund recovery after a crypto exploit is considered a significant victory. Unlike traditional finance, where fraudulent transactions can sometimes be reversed through intermediaries, DeFi platforms operate on the principle of immutability. Once funds are stolen in a crypto exploit , tracing and retrieving them is incredibly difficult. Therefore, the voluntary return of funds, even a portion, can be interpreted in several ways: White Hat Move? It‚Äôs possible the exploiter is attempting to portray their actions as a ‚Äòwhite hat‚Äô hack, perhaps to mitigate potential legal repercussions or reputational damage within the crypto community. Pressure from Tracking: Blockchain analysis and tracing tools are becoming increasingly sophisticated. The exploiter might be feeling the heat from on-chain investigators and decided to return a portion to reduce scrutiny. Negotiation Tactic: In some past incidents, exploiters have returned funds as part of a negotiation for a bounty or to avoid further pursuit. It remains to be seen if this is the case with KiloEx. The Ongoing Challenge of DeFi Security The KiloEx crypto exploit is a stark reminder of the ever-present need for enhanced DeFi security protocols. While decentralization offers numerous benefits, it also introduces unique security challenges. Smart contract vulnerabilities, protocol design flaws, and even human error can be exploited, leading to significant financial losses. Key Challenges in DeFi Security: Challenge Description Smart Contract Vulnerabilities Code errors in smart contracts can be exploited to drain funds. Rigorous auditing and formal verification are crucial. Oracle Manipulation DeFi protocols often rely on external data feeds (oracles). If these oracles are compromised, it can lead to manipulation of the protocol. Rug Pulls & Exit Scams Malicious actors can create DeFi projects with the intent to abscond with user funds, known as rug pulls. Flash Loan Attacks Exploiters use flash loans (uncollateralized loans taken and repaid within the same transaction) to manipulate market prices or protocol logic. Centralization Risks Even in DeFi, some level of centralization can exist, creating single points of failure. What Does This Fund Recovery Mean for KiloEx and Users? The return of $1.4 million is undoubtedly positive news for KiloEx and its users. It demonstrates a degree of accountability, however unexpected, in the aftermath of a significant crypto exploit . However, it‚Äôs crucial to remember that a substantial portion of the stolen funds ‚Äì approximately $5.6 million ‚Äì remains unreturned. Implications of Partial Fund Recovery: Partial Relief: While not a full resolution, the recovered funds can help mitigate the financial impact on KiloEx and potentially compensate affected users to some extent. Reputational Boost (Slight): The return might slightly improve KiloEx‚Äôs reputation, showing some effort towards resolving the situation, although the initial exploit still casts a shadow. Ongoing Investigation: The investigation into the exploit will likely continue to determine the full extent of the vulnerability and prevent future incidents. Focus on Security: KiloEx, and the wider DeFi space, will need to double down on DeFi security measures, including enhanced audits, monitoring, and incident response protocols. Actionable Insights: Strengthening DeFi Security The KiloEx incident and subsequent partial fund recovery provide valuable lessons for both DeFi platforms and users: Robust Audits are Essential: DeFi projects must prioritize comprehensive and frequent smart contract audits from reputable security firms. Multi-Sig Wallets & Governance: Implementing multi-signature wallets for critical functions and robust governance mechanisms can reduce the risk of unauthorized access and exploits. Real-time Monitoring & Alert Systems: Deploying advanced monitoring tools and alert systems can help detect and respond to suspicious activity quickly. User Education: Educating users about DeFi risks, security best practices, and due diligence is crucial for fostering a safer ecosystem. Incident Response Plans: Having well-defined incident response plans in place allows platforms to react swiftly and effectively in case of a security breach. Conclusion: A Silver Lining in the DeFi Security Landscape The partial fund recovery in the KiloEx crypto exploit saga offers a rare silver lining in the often-turbulent world of DeFi. While the initial $7 million breach was a significant blow, the return of $1.4 million provides a glimmer of hope and underscores the evolving dynamics between exploiters and DeFi security efforts. It‚Äôs a powerful reminder that while the risks in DeFi are real, so too is the resilience and the ongoing pursuit of greater security within this innovative space. The incident should serve as a catalyst for continued vigilance and proactive measures to safeguard the future of decentralized finance. To learn more about the latest DeFi Security trends, explore our article on key developments shaping DeFi security protocols and best practices .

title: Crucial Crossroads for Mantra DAO: Community to Decide Fate of CEO‚Äôs OM Tokens
body: In a fascinating turn of events in the crypto world, John Patrick Mullin, the CEO of Mantra DAO, has placed a significant decision directly into the hands of the community. Mullin, known for his transparent approach, is seeking input on what to do with his substantial allocation of 772,081 team-allocated OM tokens, currently staked on Fluxtra. This move highlights the growing importance of community governance in decentralized projects and sets a compelling precedent for other leaders in the space. Let‚Äôs dive into the details of this intriguing situation and explore what it could mean for Mantra DAO and the broader crypto ecosystem. Why is the Mantra DAO CEO seeking community input on his OM tokens? Transparency and decentralization are at the heart of blockchain technology and cryptocurrencies. Mullin‚Äôs decision to involve the Mantra DAO community in this matter underscores these core principles. By seeking feedback on his OM token burn decision, he‚Äôs not just paying lip service to decentralization; he‚Äôs actively embodying it. Here‚Äôs a breakdown of why this is a noteworthy development: Empowering the Community: This action truly empowers OM token holders, giving them a direct voice in a decision that could impact the token‚Äôs ecosystem. It moves beyond passive holding and encourages active participation. Building Trust: Openly seeking community guidance builds trust and strengthens the relationship between the leadership and the community. It demonstrates that the CEO values the community‚Äôs perspective and is willing to act upon it. Decentralized Decision-Making: This initiative is a practical example of decentralized decision-making in action. Instead of unilaterally deciding the fate of the tokens, Mullin is leveraging the collective wisdom of the community. Setting a Precedent: Mullin‚Äôs move could set a new standard for leadership transparency and community involvement in crypto projects, encouraging other leaders to adopt similar practices. Decoding the Options for OM Token Management: What‚Äôs on the Table? Mullin presented four distinct options for the community to consider regarding his OM tokens . Each option carries different implications for the tokenomics and the future of Mantra DAO. Let‚Äôs break down each choice: Immediate Token Burn: Benefit: Immediately reducing the total supply of OM tokens could potentially increase scarcity and value for existing holders. This is a deflationary measure that is often viewed positively by token communities. Challenge: Burning such a significant amount of tokens at once might have unforeseen market reactions. It also removes a substantial amount of tokens from potential future use within the ecosystem. Extended Vesting Period: Benefit: Extending the vesting period for these tokens could signal long-term commitment from the CEO and alleviate any concerns about potential market dumping. It provides a more gradual release of tokens over time. Challenge: This option might not be as exciting to the community as a token burn, and it essentially maintains the status quo for a longer duration. Community Multisig Wallet: Benefit: Placing the tokens in a community multisig wallet offers a high degree of transparency and security. It ensures that the tokens can only be moved with the approval of multiple community-elected signatories. This fosters trust and collective control. Challenge: Deciding on the use of these tokens within the multisig wallet would require further community consensus and governance processes. Defining the exact purpose and operational framework of the multisig could be complex. Milestone-Based Unlock: Benefit: Unlocking tokens based on predefined milestones aligns incentives between the CEO and the community. It ties token release to the actual progress and success of the Mantra DAO project, encouraging development and growth. Challenge: Defining clear, measurable, and universally agreed-upon milestones can be challenging. There‚Äôs also the risk of disagreements on whether milestones have been adequately met. The Power of Community in Crypto: Why This Poll Matters This poll is more than just a temperature check; it‚Äôs a significant moment for community governance in the cryptocurrency space. It highlights a crucial shift towards more participatory and decentralized models of project management. Here‚Äôs why this community input is so important: Real Decentralization in Action: Many crypto projects talk about decentralization, but few actively involve their communities in significant decisions like this. Mantra DAO is taking concrete steps to walk the walk. Strengthening the Ecosystem: By involving the community, Mantra DAO is strengthening its ecosystem. A community that feels heard and valued is more likely to be engaged, supportive, and contribute to the project‚Äôs long-term success. Inspiration for Other Projects: This initiative can serve as an inspiration for other crypto projects to adopt more community-centric governance models. It demonstrates the benefits of transparency and participatory decision-making. Navigating Complex Decisions: Tokenomics and token distribution are complex areas. Community input can provide diverse perspectives and help navigate these complexities more effectively, leading to potentially better outcomes for the project as a whole. What‚Äôs Next for Mantra DAO and the OM Token Vesting Decision? The outcome of this community poll will be closely watched by the crypto community. While Mullin has clarified that the poll is non-binding, it will undoubtedly play a significant role in shaping his final decision. Here are some potential next steps: Analyzing Community Sentiment: Mullin and the Mantra DAO team will carefully analyze the results of the poll to understand the community‚Äôs preferred direction. Further Discussions: Depending on the poll results, there might be further community discussions and refinements of the proposed options. Final Decision and Implementation: Ultimately, Mullin will make a decision, likely taking the community feedback into strong consideration. The chosen course of action will then be implemented, affecting the future of his token vesting and the OM token ecosystem. Long-Term Impact on Governance: This event could have a lasting impact on Mantra DAO‚Äôs governance model, potentially leading to more structured and formalized community involvement in future decisions. Conclusion: A Bold Step Towards Decentralized Crypto Governance Mantra DAO‚Äôs CEO John Patrick Mullin‚Äôs move to seek community input on his OM token burn decision is a bold and commendable step towards true decentralized community governance . It exemplifies the spirit of crypto and sets a powerful example for other projects to follow. By empowering its community, Mantra DAO is not only making a crucial decision in a transparent and inclusive manner but also strengthening its foundations for long-term success in the dynamic world of cryptocurrencies. The crypto world will be keenly observing how this unfolds, as it could very well be a watershed moment in the evolution of decentralized governance. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action.

title: The key to boosting growth in the tokenized credit market: Funding cross-border payments | Opinion
body: Disclosure: The views and opinions expressed here belong solely to the author and do not represent the views and opinions of crypto.news‚Äô editorial. Over the past decade, the tokenized credit market has soared to new heights. The industry, which converts traditional credit products, such as loans, bonds, or other debt instruments, into digital tokens that exist on a blockchain, has helped to democratize the world of investment for more participants, with each token issued representing a fraction of the underlying credit asset. This fractionalisation allows the token to be easily traded, transferred, and managed on decentralised platforms. You might also like: Tokenized securities are redefining compliance | Opinion To date, $10 billion in tokenized bonds have been issued by leading institutions, including the World Bank and the City of Lugano. The market‚Äôs growing popularity stems from the significant benefits it offers‚Äîenhanced liquidity, transparency, and accessibility. Investors can now buy and sell portions of loans or bonds, making these traditionally illiquid assets more flexible and tradable. Blockchain‚Äôs transparent, immutable ledger ensures that all transactions are secure and verifiable in real time, reducing fraud and increasing trust. Additionally, tokenized credit products open the door to a broader pool of investors by lowering entry barriers, allowing even small-scale participants to invest in assets that were once limited to large institutional players. As more financial institutions and platforms adopt tokenization, this market is expected to expand, transforming how credit products are issued, traded, and managed. Yet despite this advancement, the growth of the tokenised credit market is still constrained by one critical issue: return on investment. Decentralized finance lending currently offers lower yields when compared to traditional lending markets, especially in the current high-interest rate environment. This can be solved by providing funding for cross-border payments as it is an ideal use case to expand the tokenized credit market and unlock higher yields, offering consistent cash flows and a natural fit for blockchain‚Äôs speed and cost-efficiency. The core challenges: Low yields and volatility The total allocation of the tokenized credit market remains relatively small compared to the size of the multi-trillion-dollar global bond market. The limited allocation is largely due to challenges in liquidity, investor hesitancy concerning yields, and regulatory uncertainty. Concerning returns, the tokenised credit market currently offers an average yield of around 9.65% on $10 billion of tokenised credit assets. While this might seem attractive compared to traditional bond yields, tractional private credit markets saw average yields of 12% from 2018 to 2023, leading many investors to still view DeFi as volatile and uncertain. Therefore, to unlock further growth, it is critical that the industry addresses yield-related issues and enhances investor confidence in the pioneering asset class. Institutional investors demand not just high yields but also stability and predictability. In traditional credit markets, low volatility and reliable income streams are key drivers of investment flows, whereas the DeFi sector is still seen as nascent and volatile. The ecosystem needs to prove that it can generate attractive, risk-adjusted returns for both institutional and retail investors. This means improving the robustness of the platforms and expanding the range of available asset classes, such as into payments. Increasing yields to boost growth To drive greater adoption and attract more capital into tokenised credit markets, several strategies are necessary to make yields more attractive: Enhance liquidity. One of the key factors limiting yield attractiveness is liquidity, as tokenized assets must have deeper secondary markets to allow investors to exit positions easily without significantly affecting prices. This can be achieved by expanding the number of platforms that offer trading of tokenized debt assets, and increasing institutional participation can help create the necessary liquidity for more stable returns. Broaden asset classes. The tokenized credit market is currently focused on a narrow range of assets, such as mortgages and corporate bonds. However, to make yields more appealing, the market needs to diversify into other asset classes. Tokenizing revenue-generating assets like payments, real estate, and infrastructure projects could provide higher yields and open up new opportunities for investors who are seeking different risk-return profiles. Leverage stable asset classes. Integrating more stable, low-risk asset classes into the DeFi ecosystem could help balance the risk-reward equation. For example, tokenized government bonds or investment-grade corporate debt could offer lower but more stable yields, which may be attractive to institutional investors or pension funds looking for secure, long-term returns. Finding new asset classes for tokenization To ensure sustained growth in the tokenized credit market, new asset classes must be explored. The current landscape focuses heavily on fixed-income instruments, but there are untapped opportunities in sectors including real estate, intellectual property rights, royalties, and even carbon credits. However, the payments industry presents the best asset class for the expansion of the tokenized credit market. Playing a fundamental role in all global commerce, the payments industry handles extremely high transaction volumes with largely consistent returns. Cross-border payments are of particular interest; each provider must maintain sufficient liquidity in each jurisdiction in which it operates to provide fast and low-cost transactions, forming a significant burden for aspiring founders and scaling payment companies. This burden creates huge inefficiencies and locks up capital that could otherwise be invested or otherwise used more productively elsewhere. The tokenized credit market offers an effective solution to this problem, lending to cross-border payment companies to enable them to operate pre-funded accounts in more jurisdictions, reaching a market untapped by traditional lenders due to high perceived risks and archaic due diligence processes. Utilising on-chain collateral for loans and offering highly flexible lines of credit, the tokenised credit market can go where the traditional private lending market never could, gaining access to a key source of transaction volume and higher yields. The future of tokenized credit markets As the tokenised credit market continues to evolve, funding payments companies stand out as an important asset class that can generate higher yields and attract more capital, enabling the tokenised credit market to take the next step in its growth. To ensure the broader DeFi ecosystem thrives, the sector must focus on enhancing liquidity, stabilising yields, and diversifying into new asset classes, be that the payments industry or any other sector with high demand for flexible, on-chain liquidity. Read more: The secret to a high-performing portfolio? Automation | Opinion Author: Mouloukou Sanoh Mouloukou Sanoh is an experienced investor and operator, with private equity and investment banking in his arsenal. He co-founded Cassava, Africa‚Äôs largest web3 platform, and led key investments at Adaverse, Cardano‚Äôs venture arm. He was on Forbes 30 Under 30 2023.

title: US DOJ considers fairer repayment standards for crypto fraud victims
body: The US Department of Justice (DOJ) wants to review the repayment process for digital assets investors who lose money to fraud and other criminal activities. An April 7 memo from the DOJ acknowledged that these investors are not getting the full value of their digital assets. According to the memo by the Deputy Attorney General (DAG), several crypto firms entered bankruptcy in 2022, causing investors losses. The memo noted that losses in some cases were due to fraud and theft, and the DOJ recovered the proceeds of this criminal activity, including digital assets, through forfeitures. However, it observed that the increase in the value of digital assets over the period was not reflected in the repayment to the victims, because regulations that require the return of forfeited assets to victims should be at their fair value at the time of the fraud. It said: ‚ÄúHowever, as a result of regulations, some digital asset investor victims have only been able to recover the value of their digital assets at the time the fraud was perpetrated.‚Äù The memo noted that this issue deserves to be addressed because it does not favor investors who bear all the risks of the loss. These investors do not benefit from the increase in the value of the digital assets when they could have possessed the assets if not for the loss. DOJ wants to evaluate the bankruptcy rules and propose changes In order to address this, the DAG has now directed the Office of Legal Policy and the Office of Legislative Affairs to evaluate the issue and propose regulatory and legislative changes that will improve asset forfeiture efforts in the digital sector. It is uncertain what proposals the DOJ will come up with to resolve this issue. A possible solution could be to return assets in kind, which could be risky as assets could decline to zero. Implementing any proposed changes could also prove tricky, as the Bankruptcy Code requires Congress to amend. Still, the department can issue regulations or rules. Ironically, the rule the DOJ referenced in its memo actually exists to protect investors against losses. It requires that losses returned to victims be at fair market value as at the date of loss, and where there are several victims, each will get a portion of the assets on a pro rata basis. However, the rule does not favor crypto investors as the value of crypto assets can increase, and the pro-rata refund means those who invested in valuable projects such as Bitcoin get the same as those who invest in memecoins. Crypto investors welcome the development Meanwhile, many in the crypto community consider the memo a good move, even if it is only guidance for the DOJ staff and does not have the force of law. Investors affected by the bankruptcy of crypto firms such as FTX, Voyager, Celsius, Genesis, Blockfi, and Gemini believe this was long overdue. FTX creditor champion Sunil Kavuri highlighted the development in a post on X, and followers‚Äô comments show that they support it even though they believe it might be too late to save victims of previous crypto bankruptcies. One user, Mr Purple on X, added that the Bankruptcy Code needs to be reformed to account for the unique nature of digital assets. He said: ‚ÄúSeriously (and critically) this needs also include a reform to the bankruptcy code to account for the unique nature of digital assets that may become subject to or inclusive of a bankruptcy proceeding.‚Äù With the majority viewing the idea as a common-sense move, all eyes are on the DOJ to see how it will modify the asset forfeiture rules to accommodate the crypto sector. title: Bitcoin Holds $84.6K ‚Äî Trump & Kraken Steal the Show
body: Bitcoin steadied near $84,595 on Thursday, posting a modest 0.23% gain. Despite the quiet session, BTC continues to consolidate within a tight $82,000‚Äì$87,000 range, reflecting cautious sentiment. Traders appear hesitant, awaiting a macro or crypto-specific catalyst to fuel the next directional move. Momentum has cooled, but bulls are defending key levels. A confirmed breakout above $85,500 could open the door to a fresh rally. Key Levels to Watch: Support: $83,879 Resistance: $85,508 Targets: $86,446 and $87,416 A confirmed close above $85,500 could open the door to a fresh rally, but until then, sideways action may dominate. Trump Criticizes Fed Chair Powell for Delay in Rate Cuts President Donald Trump ramped up pressure on Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, criticizing him for being ‚Äútoo late‚Äù on interest rate cuts. Posting on Truth Social after the European Central Bank lowered rates, Trump claimed Powell‚Äôs ‚Äútermination cannot come fast enough,‚Äù despite lacking legal grounds to remove him. Powell, unfazed, reaffirmed the Fed‚Äôs independence and confirmed his intention to serve out his term through 2026. JUST IN: Trump criticized Fed Chair Jerome Powell for being "Too Late" in cutting interest rates, urging immediate action and calling for his dismissal. pic.twitter.com/06VECzZh5O ‚Äî ChainDesk (@ChainDesk_) April 17, 2025 This political tension has rattled markets. While Fed funds futures price in a 65% chance of a rate cut by June, May remains unlikely at just 10%. Any signs of easing could improve liquidity and risk appetite‚Äîtypically a bullish setup for Bitcoin. Kraken Diversifies with Stocks as Silbert Reflects on BTC Miss Crypto exchange Kraken is expanding beyond digital assets, offering commission-free trading on over 11,000 U.S. stocks and ETFs. The move follows Kraken‚Äôs $1.5 billion acquisition of NinjaTrader and signals a strategic shift toward becoming a full-spectrum financial platform. Kraken Cuts Hundreds of Jobs Ahead of IPO to Boost Profitability Summary: Crypto exchange Kraken has laid off hundreds of employees across departments in recent months to streamline operations and improve EBITA ahead of its anticipated IPO, Coindesk reported. The‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/v29JqNNbC8 ‚Äî PiQ (@PiQSuite) April 17, 2025 Meanwhile, Barry Silbert, CEO of Digital Currency Group, admitted he would‚Äôve earned more just holding Bitcoin than investing in crypto startups like Coinbase. Buying BTC at $7‚Äì$8 in 2011, he now regrets allocating it toward underperforming companies, saying most crypto tokens are ‚Äúworthless.‚Äù Institutional sentiment, however, is growing. Michael Saylor and members of Trump‚Äôs Crypto Council foresee BTC hitting $1 million, with talk of the U.S. buying Bitcoin via trade surpluses or gold revaluation. VanEck even claims BTC-backed bonds could trim $14 trillion off U.S. debt. Bottom Line: A Calm Market Hiding Growing Tension Bitcoin‚Äôs current price stability may be deceptive. With Fed policy under political fire, Kraken bridging into traditional finance, and Bitcoin‚Äôs institutional narrative gaining strength, the stage is set for volatility to return. Traders would be wise to stay alert‚Äîbecause this quiet phase could give way to a major move. BTC Bull Token Presale Tops $4.76M as Bitcoin Hovers Near $85K As Bitcoin edges closer to the $85,000 mark and macro uncertainty intensifies, BTC Bull Token ($BTCBULL) continues to gain traction with retail and crypto-savvy investors. This Ethereum-based meme coin stands out by offering real Bitcoin airdrops every time BTC hits key price milestones‚Äîaligning directly with Bitcoin‚Äôs long-term upside. Earn Bitcoin with 86% APY Through Staking Beyond the airdrop rewards, BTC Bull‚Äôs staking program remains a major draw. Investors can earn up to 86% APY in passive income, while also contributing to the token‚Äôs network strength. The ability to unstake anytime makes it flexible for new and seasoned holders alike. title: KiloEX exchange exploiter returns $5.5M days after $7.5M hack
body: The hacker behind the $7.5 million KiloEx exploit returned $5.5 million worth of cryptocurrency just four days after the attack occurred. Decentralized exchange (DEX) KiloEx suspended platform operations after suffering a $7.5 million exploit , Cointelegraph reported on April 15. In a surprising turn of events, the wallet address behind the exploit has returned $5.5 million worth of cryptocurrency to the DEX. KiloEX exploiter returns $5.5m. Source: PeckShieldAlert ‚Äú#KiloEx exploiter -labeled addresses have returned ~$5.5M worth of cryptos to #KiloEx,‚Äù according to an April 18 X post from blockchain security platform PeckShieldAlert. Related: Mantra OM token crash exposes ‚Äòcritical‚Äô liquidity issues in crypto The unexpected repayment occurred after KiloEx offered a $750,000 ‚Äúwhite hat‚Äù bounty to the hacker ‚Äî 10% of the stolen amount ‚Äî if the hacker returned 90% of the looted assets. The platform said it was working with law enforcement and cybersecurity firms, including Seal-911 , SlowMist and Sherlock, to uncover more about the hacker‚Äôs activity and identity. The initial attack may have been caused due to a ‚Äúprice oracle issue,‚Äù where the information used by a smart contract to determine the price of an asset is manipulated or inaccurate , leading to the exploit, PeckShield said in an April 14 X post. Related: Top 100 DeFi Hacks: Offchain attack vectors account for 57% of losses This is a developing story, and further information will be added as it becomes available.

title: Dogecoin Price Prediction, Fartcoin To Flip Shiba Inu, Another Chance To Buy XRP Below $0.10
body: DOGE, FARTCOIN, and SHIB are creating ripples in a market that is starving for momentum. As Dogecoin attempts to retake old highs, Fartcoin‚Äôs run has reversed sentiment in the meme coin sphere. Elsewhere, rumors of XRP breaking below $0.10 have some investors grabbing for the dip-buying trigger. But one project called Remittix (RTX) is causing a stir for a different reason‚Äîand it‚Äôs not a meme. DOGE struggles to push higher despite trading uptick DOGE , the popular meme coin, is trading higher by a modest margin at $0.1568, while its trading volume increased by 8.03% to $838.09 million. In spite of its $23.36 billion market capitalization, DOGE appears to be consolidating as traders wait for a larger catalyst. Speculation remains about a possible Dogecoin integration with X (previously Twitter), which has been hinted at for months. Yet without confirmation, DOGE‚Äôs price action has been largely sideways. Dogecoin enthusiasts are loyal, but the market is getting saturated. As investors seek tokens that have more recent trends, DOGE might require more than hype to keep its spot in the market. Fartcoin rockets upward‚Äîcan it flip SHIB for good? The FARTCOIN vs. SHIB battle just got exciting. FARTCOIN is changing hands at $0.9448 following a 13.20% gain in the past 24 hours. That bullish momentum is accompanied by a $943.92 million market capitalization and a whopping $355.25 million daily trading volume. SHIB , meanwhile, is trailing behind at $0.00001190‚Äîup only 0.67% with $145.52 million in volume. Its $7.01 billion market cap still has it in front, but momentum is turning. As FARTCOIN gets exposed and SHIB remains in the same pattern of slow burns and long-term promises, it‚Äôs no wonder traders believe FARTCOIN might flip SHIB prior to Q3. Meme coins live and die by momentum, and right now, FARTCOIN has the spark. Remittix presale surges with real-world use cases Whereas DOGE, SHIB, and FARTCOIN headline the news for their volatility, Remittix is providing something that investors can truly utilize. Having raised nearly $14.5 million and sold over 528 million tokens, the Remittix presale is picking up some serious momentum. Now trading for just $0.0734, the project is gaining attention due to its real-world use case in cross-border payments. And, in contrast to meme coins, Remittix isn‚Äôt attempting to surf a joke‚Äîit‚Äôs addressing a billion-dollar issue. For example, a virtual worker in Latin America can now be paid by a European employer in minutes‚Äîat close to zero fees. Or consider a small business owner in Kenya paying for goods in Turkey without worrying about unstable currency exchanges. Remittix makes that possible using blockchain-enabled fiat settlements. Its primary mission? Remove delays, exorbitant fees, and intermediaries in the cross-border payment industry. This is particularly potent in areas where access to banks is insufficient or unstable. Most importantly, Remittix isn‚Äôt fluffy speculation‚Äîit‚Äôs constructing something with obvious demand. That‚Äôs why some analysts are calling for 10x by the end of April. Even amidst the meme coin-driven headlines, smart investors are redirecting funds to Remittix. They‚Äôre done with basing everything on market sentiment. They crave function‚Äîand Remittix provides it. Also to consider: while meme coins like DOGE and SHIB see-saw from hype within the community and Elon‚Äôs tweets, the value of Remittix lies in the number of lives that it is able to impact tangibly. The fundraising pace is indication enough that investors are taking notice. Is XRP actually going under $0.10? The prospect of purchasing XRP at under $0.10 would have been unthinkable in 2023. However, as altcoin corrections sweep across the market, some speculators are gambling on just that. Regulatory uncertainty and slow price action have weighed on XRP‚Äôs momentum. And although its use in institutional finance is still important, price support is still thinning at crucial levels. Nevertheless, this forecast is contentious. Most XRP enthusiasts believe the coin is already seriously undervalued. But the reality is, if the general market doesn‚Äôt bounce back, a drop below $0.10 isn‚Äôt entirely out of the question. For the time being, the more intelligent move might not be doubling down on XRP or even DOGE or SHIB‚Äîit could be putting capital into projects like Remittix that are still in the infancy stage. Beyond DOGE, FARTCOIN, and SHIB As meme token wars continue, DOGE remains the king‚Äîbut for how much longer? FARTCOIN has new momentum and will soon dethrone SHIB. However, during a bearish or doubting market, utility takes the day. That‚Äôs where Remittix steps in. With an increasing community, a $14.5M raise, and more than 528 million tokens sold, this presale isn‚Äôt just catching up‚Äîit‚Äôs running ahead. If you‚Äôre a DOGE fan, a would-be FARTCOIN fan, or just still clinging to SHIB, it may be time to start thinking about what‚Äôs actually next. And if the last few weeks are any guide, the answer could be Remittix. Join the Remittix (RTX) presale and community: Join Remittix (RTX) Presale Join the Remittix (RTX) Community

title: Jerome Powell May Be Fired by Trump! Elizabeth Warren Predicts Market Crash
body: The post Jerome Powell May Be Fired by Trump! Elizabeth Warren Predicts Market Crash appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News The crypto market in 2025 was supposed to boom, but reality hit differently. Bitcoin soared to $109K after Trump‚Äôs inauguration, only to crash back to earth as tariff fears and regulatory delays wiped out early gains. Now, as BTC struggles to hold the $84K level, Trump‚Äôs latest remarks about Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell have sparked fresh concerns. ‚ÄúIt Will Crash Markets‚Äù: Warren Slams Trump‚Äôs Powell Threat Senator Elizabeth Warren, known for her sharp criticism of both Wall Street and the Federal Reserve, surprisingly stepped in to defend Powell, but only to a point. Speaking on CNBC , she made it clear that she still disagrees with Powell on many policies. However, she believes protecting the Fed‚Äôs independence is crucial for the health of the U.S. economy. ‚ÄúIf Chairman Powell can be fired by the president of the United States, it will crash markets,‚Äù Warren said bluntly from the New York Stock Exchange. Her main argument was that the central bank must operate free from political pressure. If it doesn‚Äôt, global investors could lose confidence in the U.S. system, comparing it to ‚Äúany other two-bit dictatorship.‚Äù Trump‚Äôs Truth Social Post Targets Powell, On Thursday, Trump posted on Truth Social , calling Powell ‚Äú always TOO LATE AND WRONG ‚Äù and adding that his ‚Äútermination cannot come fast enough.‚Äù Although a senior White House official later clarified that Trump‚Äôs post wasn‚Äôt an official firing attempt, the tone alone sent shockwaves through markets and among lawmakers. Powell has previously stated that a president cannot fire a Fed chair without cause , and no formal legal challenge has been made‚Äîyet. .article-inside-link { margin-left: 0 !important; border: 1px solid #0052CC4D; border-left: 0; border-right: 0; padding: 10px 0; text-align: left; } .entry ul.article-inside-link li { font-size: 14px; line-height: 21px; font-weight: 600; list-style-type: none; margin-bottom: 0; display: inline-block; } .entry ul.article-inside-link li:last-child { display: none; } Also Read : Crypto Markets Slide as Powell Flags Stagflation Risks, Tariff Troubles; Warns of Tough Road Ahead , Trump‚Äôs Tariff Games and Powell Pressure Could Shake Global Confidence The Fed raised interest rates aggressively during Biden‚Äôs term to fight post-pandemic inflation, and while it began easing in 2024, Powell signaled recently that he‚Äôs not rushing more cuts, especially given the uncertainty surrounding Trump‚Äôs changing tariff plans. While Trump temporarily calmed markets with a 90-day pause on tariffs , once this window is over, this tariff mess can further crash the market. On the other side, if he tries to remove Powell, he might create further market instability, as warned by several senior senators. Warren‚Äôs warning isn‚Äôt just political, it‚Äôs a call to preserve the foundations of the global economy. title: Analyst Said "Every Time Gold Rises First, Then Bitcoin (BTC) Rises", Announced the Expected Date for the Rise!
body: While US President Donald Trump‚Äôs tariff statements and the ongoing tariff tension between China and the US brought gold to the forefront, Bitcoin lagged behind. While gold has attracted great interest among investors with its safe haven narrative amid the ongoing economic uncertainty, gold continues to see strong inflows as Bitcoin lags behind amid risk-off sentiment. At this point, while gold is rising to new record levels, Bitcoin is failing to make the expected explosion. Bitcoin Follows Gold! However, one analyst noted that the rise in gold is also a bullish signal for Bitcoin, saying that BTC tends to mirror gold‚Äôs highs over the past 150 days. While new records in gold have led to speculation on whether Bitcoin is about to rally, analyst Joe Consorti said that Bitcoin typically follows gold‚Äôs price movements within 100 to 150 days of gold reaching new ATHs. Consorti stated that when monetary expansion started, gold first reacted and rose, and then BTC followed the gold rise more strongly. As an example, Consorti pointed to the years 2027 and 2021. In 2017, Bitcoin rose to $19,120 a few months after gold witnessed a 30% increase. Similarly, gold reached a new peak near $2,075 in 2020 during the COVID-19 pandemic before Bitcoin surged to $69,000 in 2021. At this point, the analyst stated that Bitcoin has historically surpassed its previous ATHs during periods when gold rose, and that BTC follows the rise of gold with a 100-150 day delay each time. ‚ÄúBitcoin lags gold by about 100 to 150 days. When the uptrend starts, gold starts first, then Bitcoin follows more sharply.‚Äù Based on this trend, BTC is expected to potentially reach its new ATH between the third and fourth quarter of 2025. However, only time will tell if history repeats itself once again for Bitcoin. Although this data gives an upward signal, do not make your investment decisions based on a single data or signal. These data are auxiliary data that are subject to error and have never been proven to be 100% accurate. Make your investment decisions based on your own research. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Analyst Said "Every Time Gold Rises First, Then Bitcoin (BTC) Rises", Announced the Expected Date for the Rise!

title: Justin Sun Affirms Commitment to ETH Despite Current Price Downturn
body: COINOTAG reported on April 18th that industry veteran Justin Sun commented on the current market trends affecting Ethereum (ETH). Despite the recent downturn in ETH prices, Sun affirmed his commitment
